entries.red: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.
entries.blue: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.
entries.yellow: It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the bulb on its back, it stores energy.
entries.stadium: The bulb-like pouch on its back grows larger as it ages. The pouch is filled with numerous seeds.
entries.gold: The seed on its back is filled with nutrients. The seed grows steadily larger as its body grows.
entries.silver: It carries a seed on its back right from birth. As it grows older, the seed also grows larger.
entries.crystal: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seeds on its back in order to grow.
entries.stadium2: The seed on its back is filled with nutrients. The seed grows steadily larger as its body grows.

entries.red: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
entries.blue: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
entries.yellow: The bulb on its back grows by drawing energy. It gives off an aroma when it is ready to bloom.
entries.stadium: The bud on its back apparently draws energy from its body. The bud is said to open into a large flower when fully grown.
entries.gold: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.
entries.silver: If the bud on its back starts to smell sweet, it is evidence that the large flower will soon bloom.
entries.crystal: The bulb on its back grows as it absorbs nutrients. The bulb gives off a pleasant aroma when it blooms.
entries.stadium2: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.
entries.ruby: There is a bud on this Pokémon's back. To support its weight, Ivysaur's legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it's a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.

entries.red: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
entries.blue: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
entries.yellow: The flower on its back catches the sun's rays. The sunlight is then absorbed and used for energy.
entries.stadium: Absorbs solar energy as nutrition. When it is catching the sun's rays, it often remains quiet and still.
entries.gold: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun's rays, it fills its body with power.
entries.silver: It is able to convert sunlight into energy. As a result, it is more powerful in the summertime.
entries.crystal: As it warms itself and absorbs the sunlight, its flower petals release a pleasant fragrance.
entries.stadium2: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun's rays, it fills its body with power.
entries.ruby: There is a large flower on Venusaur's back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower's aroma soothes the emotions of people.

entries.letsGoEevee: In order to support its flower, which has grown larger due to Mega Evolution, its back and legs have become stronger.

entries.sword: In battle, this Pokémon swings around two thick vines. If these vines slammed into a 10-story building, they could easily topple it.
entries.shield: Huge amounts of pollen burst from it with the force of a volcanic eruption. Breathing in too much of the pollen can cause fainting.

entries.red: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
entries.blue: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
entries.yellow: The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.
entries.stadium: Even the newborns have flaming tails. Unfamiliar with fire, babies are said to accidentally burn themselves.
entries.gold: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life force. If it is weak, the flame also burns weakly.
entries.silver: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.
entries.crystal: If it's healthy, the flame on the tip of its tail will burn vigorously, even if it gets a bit wet.
entries.stadium2: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life force. If it is weak, the flame also burns weakly.
entries.ruby: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.

entries.emerald: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is happy, and blazes when it is enraged.

entries.red: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.
entries.blue: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.
entries.yellow: Tough fights could excite this Pokémon. When excited, it may blow out bluish-white flames.
entries.stadium: It appears to be very vicious. It attacks with razor-sharp claws and won't stop until the enemy is defeated.
entries.gold: It is very hot-headed by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents. It calms down only when it wins.
entries.silver: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
entries.crystal: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.
entries.stadium2: It is very hot-headed by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents. It calms down only when it wins.
entries.ruby: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.
entries.sapphire: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.
entries.emerald: Without pity, its sharp claws destroy foes. If it encounters a strong enemy, it becomes agitated, and the flame on its tail flares with a bluish white color.
entries.firered: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.
entries.leafgreen: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the air temperature to unbearably high levels.

entries.red: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.
entries.blue: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.
entries.yellow: When expelling a blast of super hot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.
entries.stadium: Its fiery breath reaches incredible temperatures. It can quickly melt glaciers weighing 10,000 tons.
entries.gold: If Charizard becomes furious, the flame at the tip of its tail flares up into a whitish-blue color.
entries.silver: Breathing intense, hot flames, it can melt almost anything. Its breath inflicts terrible pain on enemies.
entries.crystal: It uses its wings to fly high. The temperature of its fire increases as it gains experience in battle.
entries.stadium2: If Charizard becomes furious, the flame at the tip of its tail flares up in a whitish-blue color.
entries.ruby: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.
entries.sapphire: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.
entries.emerald: A Charizard flies about in search of strong opponents. It breathes intense flames that can melt any material. However, it will never torch a weaker foe.
entries.firered: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
entries.leafgreen: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
entries.diamond: It is said that Charizard's fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

entries.letsGoPikachu: The overwhelming power that fills its entire body causes it to turn black and creates intense blue flames.
entries.letsGoEevee: The overwhelming power that fills its entire body causes it to turn black and creates intense blue flames.

entries.letsGoPikachu: Its bond with its Trainer is the source of its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability greater than that of a jet fighter.
entries.letsGoEevee: Its bond with its Trainer is the source of its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability greater than that of a jet fighter.

entries.sword: This colossal, flame-winged figure of a Charizard was brought about by Gigantamax energy.
entries.shield: The flame inside its body burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit. When Charizard roars, that temperature climbs even higher.

entries.red: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.
entries.blue: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.
entries.yellow: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
entries.stadium: It takes time for the shell to form and harden after hatching. It sprays foam powerfully from its mouth.
entries.gold: The shell is soft when it is born. It soon becomes so resilient, prodding fingers will bounce off it.
entries.silver: The shell, which hardens soon after it is born, is resilient. If you poke it, it will bounce back out.
entries.crystal: When it feels threatened, it draws its legs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.
entries.stadium2: The shell is soft when it is born. It soon becomes so resilient, prodding fingers will bounce off it.
entries.ruby: Squirtle's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.
entries.sapphire: Squirtle's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.
entries.emerald: Its shell is not just for protection. Its rounded shape and the grooves on its surface minimize resistance in water, enabling Squirtle to swim at high speeds.
entries.firered: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

entries.red: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
entries.blue: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
entries.yellow: When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
entries.stadium: The tail is covered with a rich fur. It stores air in the fur before taking extended dives underwater.
entries.gold: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
entries.silver: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.
entries.crystal: Its long, furry tail is a symbol of longevity, making it quite popular among older people.

entries.ruby: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon's toughness as a battler.

entries.leafgreen: It often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For fast swimming, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

entries.red: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.
entries.blue: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.
entries.yellow: Once it takes aim at its enemy, it blasts out water with even more force than a fire hose.
entries.stadium: It has spouts extending from its shell at the top. They spray water like cannons, hard enough to pierce concrete walls.
entries.gold: It deliberately makes itself heavy so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.
entries.silver: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel
entries.crystal: It firmly plants its feet on the ground before shooting water from the jets on its back.
entries.stadium2: It deliberately makes itself heavy so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.

entries.emerald: The waterspouts that protrude from its shell are highly accurate. Their bullets of water can precisely nail tin cans from a distance of over 160 feet.

entries.shield: Water fired from this Pokémon's central main cannon has enough power to blast a hole into a mountain.

entries.blue: This Pokémon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

entries.gold: Inside the shell, it is soft and weak as it prepares to evolve. It stays motionless in the shell.
entries.silver: It prepares for evolution by hardening its shell as much as possible to protect its soft body.

entries.shield: Once it has opponents trapped in a tornado that could blow away a 10-ton truck, it finishes them off with its poisonous scales.

entries.blue: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

entries.red: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

entries.yellow: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, it is certain that 40 more live in the area.

entries.silver: Living wherever there is food available, it ceaselessly scavenges for edibles the entire day.

entries.sun: With its incisors, it gnaws through doors and infiltrates people's homes. Then, with a twitch of its whiskers, it steals whatever food it finds.
entries.moon: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for the boss of its nest—Raticate.
entries.ultraSun: It shows no interest in anything that isn't fresh. If you take it shopping with you, it will help you pick out ingredients.
entries.ultraMoon: Night after night, they sneak into people's homes seeking food. A massive outbreak of them has become an issue of public concern.

entries.letsGoEevee: Its whiskers provide it with a keen sense of smell, enabling it to pick up the scent of hidden food and locate it instantly.

entries.sun: It forms a group of Rattata, which it assumes command of. Each group has its own territory, and disputes over food happen often.

entries.ultraSun: It has an incredibly greedy personality. Its nest is filled with so much food gathered by Rattata at its direction, it can't possibly eat it all.
entries.ultraMoon: It commands a nest of Rattata. Different nests don't get along, whipping up severe fights over feeding grounds.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It makes its Rattata underlings gather food for it, dining solely on the most nutritious and delicious fare.
entries.letsGoEevee: It makes its Rattata underlings gather food for it, dining solely on the most nutritious and delicious fare.

entries.diamond: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
entries.pearl: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
entries.platinum: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
entries.heartgold: It can freely detach its jaw to swallow large prey whole. It can become too heavy to move, however.
entries.soulsilver: It always hides in grass. When first born, it has no poison, so its bite is painful, but harmless.
entries.black: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
entries.white: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
entries.black2: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
entries.white2: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
entries.x: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
entries.y: Moving silently and stealthily, it eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.
entries.omegaRuby: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.
entries.alphaSapphire: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.
entries.ultraSun: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.
entries.ultraMoon: The eggs of bird Pokémon are its favorite food. It swallows eggs whole, so sometimes an egg gets stuck, and Ekans faints.
entries.letsGoPikachu: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
entries.letsGoEevee: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
entries.shiningPearl: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.

entries.red: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.
entries.blue: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.
entries.yellow: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.
entries.stadium: If it encounters an enemy, it raises its head, intimidating the opponent with the frightening pattern on its body.
entries.gold: Transfixing prey with the face-like pattern on its belly, it binds and poisons the frightened victim.
entries.silver: With a very vengeful nature, it won't give up the chase, no matter how far, once it targets its prey.
entries.crystal: To intimidate foes, it spreads its chest wide and makes eerie sounds by expelling air from its mouth.
entries.stadium2: Transfixing prey with the face like pattern on its belly, it binds and poisons the poisoned victim.
entries.ruby: This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace is impossible.
entries.sapphire: This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace is impossible.
entries.emerald: This Pokémon has a terrifically strong constricting power. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once it wraps its body around its foe, escaping is impossible.
entries.firered: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.
entries.leafgreen: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.
entries.diamond: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes when they are frozen in fear.

entries.ultraMoon: After stunning its opponents with the pattern on its stomach, it quickly wraps them up in its body and waits for them to stop moving.

entries.red: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.
entries.blue: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.
entries.yellow: It keeps its tail raised to monitor its surroundings. If you yank its tail, it will try to bite you.
entries.stadium: Lives in forests away from people. It stores electricity in its cheeks for zapping an enemy if it is attacked.
entries.gold: This intelligent Pokémon roasts hard berries with electricity to make them tender enough to eat.
entries.silver: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.
entries.crystal: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.
entries.stadium2: This intelligent Pokémon roasts hard Berries with electricity to make them tender enough to eat.
entries.ruby: Whenever Pikachu comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it's evidence that this Pokémon mistook the intensity of its charge.
entries.sapphire: This Pokémon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity when it is dozy after waking up.
entries.emerald: It stores electricity in the electric sacs on its cheeks. When it releases pent-up energy in a burst, the electric power is equal to a lightning bolt.
entries.firered: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.
entries.leafgreen: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.
entries.diamond: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the pouches on its cheeks.
entries.pearl: If it looses crackling power from the electrical pouches on its cheeks, it is being wary.
entries.platinum: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
entries.heartgold: This intelligent Pokémon roasts hard berries with electricity to make them tender enough to eat.
entries.soulsilver: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.
entries.black: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
entries.white: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
entries.black2: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
entries.white2: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
entries.x: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.
entries.y: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.
entries.omegaRuby: Whenever Pikachu comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it's evidence that this Pokémon mistook the intensity of its charge.
entries.alphaSapphire: This Pokémon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity when it is dozy after waking up.
entries.sun: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.
entries.moon: It's in its nature to store electricity. It feels stressed now and then if it's unable to fully discharge the electricity.
entries.ultraSun: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.
entries.ultraMoon: While sleeping, it generates electricity in the sacs in its cheeks. If it's not getting enough sleep, it will be able to use only weak electricity.
entries.letsGoPikachu: This forest-dwelling Pokémon stores electricity in its cheeks, so you'll feel a tingly shock if you touch it.
entries.letsGoEevee: This forest-dwelling Pokémon stores electricity in its cheeks, so you'll feel a tingly shock if you touch it.
entries.sword: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.
entries.shield: When Pikachu meet, they'll touch their tails together and exchange electricity through them as a form of greeting.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the electric sacs on its cheeks.
entries.shiningPearl: If it looses crackling power from the electric sacs on its cheeks, it is being wary.
entries.legendsArceus: Possesses cheek sacs in which it stores electricity. This clever forest-dweller roasts tough berries with an electric shock before consuming them.

entries.sun: This form of Pikachu is somewhat rare. It wears the hat of its Trainer, who is also its partner.
entries.moon: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainer's cap. Since the cap's not the right size, the fit is a bit loose.

entries.sword: Its Gigantamax power expanded, forming its supersized body and towering tail.
entries.shield: When it smashes its opponents with its bolt-shaped tail, it delivers a surge of electricity equivalent to a lightning strike.

entries.red: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.
entries.blue: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.
entries.yellow: When electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes feisty. It also glows in the dark.
entries.stadium: Its electrical attacks may reach 10,000 volts. It discharges electricity from its tail, so it is not harmed by its own power.
entries.gold: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.
entries.silver: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
entries.crystal: If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electricity from the atmosphere.
entries.stadium2: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.
entries.ruby: If the electrical sacks become excessively charged, Raichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this Pokémon's nest.
entries.sapphire: This Pokémon exudes a weak electrical charge from all over its body that makes it take on a slight glow in darkness. Raichu searches for electricity by planting its tail in the ground.
entries.emerald: This Pokémon exudes a weak electrical charge from all over its body that makes it take on a slight glow in darkness. Raichu searches for electricity by planting its tail in the ground.
entries.firered: Its electric charges can reach even 100,000 volts. Careless contact can cause even an Indian elephant to faint.
entries.leafgreen: Its long tail serves as ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
entries.diamond: It turns aggressive if it has too much electricity in its body. It discharges power through its tail.
entries.pearl: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
entries.platinum: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
entries.heartgold: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.
entries.soulsilver: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
entries.black: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
entries.white: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
entries.black2: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
entries.white2: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
entries.x: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.
entries.y: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
entries.omegaRuby: If the electrical sacs become excessively charged, Raichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this Pokémon's nest.
entries.alphaSapphire: This Pokémon exudes a weak electrical charge from all over its body that makes it take on a slight glow in darkness. Raichu plants its tail in the ground to discharge electricity.
entries.sun: It unleashes electric shocks that can reach 100,000 volts. When agitated, it can knock out even an Indian elephant.
entries.moon: It becomes aggressive when it has electricity stored up. At such times, even its Trainer has to take care to avoid being attacked.
entries.ultraSun: As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.
entries.ultraMoon: Because so many Trainers like the way Pikachu looks, you don't see this Pokémon very often.
entries.letsGoPikachu: When electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes feisty. It also glows in the dark.
entries.letsGoEevee: When electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes feisty. It also glows in the dark.
entries.sword: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
entries.shield: If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electricity from the atmosphere.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It turns aggressive if it has too much electricity in its body. It discharges power through its tail.
entries.shiningPearl: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
entries.legendsArceus: It can discharge bursts of electricity exceeding 100,000 volts—a single strike with that amount of power would incapacitate one of the Copperajah of my homeland.

entries.sun: It only evolves to this form in the Alola region. According to researchers, its diet is one of the causes of this change.
entries.moon: It uses psychokinesis to control electricity. It hops aboard its own tail, using psychic power to lift the tail and move about while riding it.
entries.ultraSun: It focuses psychic energy into its tail and rides it like it's surfing. Another name for this Pokémon is “hodad.”
entries.ultraMoon: When you rub its cheeks, a sweet fragrance comes wafting out. However, you'll also get a light shock!
entries.letsGoPikachu: It loves pancakes prepared with a secret Alolan recipe. Some wonder whether that recipe holds the key to this Pokémon's evolution.
entries.letsGoEevee: It loves pancakes prepared with a secret Alolan recipe. Some wonder whether that recipe holds the key to this Pokémon's evolution.
entries.sword: It's believed that the weather, climate, and food of the Alola region all play a part in causing Pikachu to evolve into this form of Raichu.
entries.shield: This Pokémon rides on its tail while it uses its psychic powers to levitate. It attacks with star-shaped thunderbolts.

entries.red: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.
entries.blue: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.
entries.yellow: Its body is dry. When it gets cold at night, its hide is said to become coated with a fine dew.
entries.stadium: When hunting, it hides at the lip of its burrow. If prey comes close, it lunges out and drags in the prey instantly.
entries.gold: If it fell from a great height, this Pokémon could save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.
entries.silver: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.
entries.crystal: It prefers dry, sandy places because it uses the sand to protect itself when threatened.
entries.stadium2: If it fell from a great height, this Pokémon could save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.
entries.ruby: Sandshrew's body is configured to absorb water without waste, enabling it to survive in an arid desert. This Pokémon curls up to protect itself from its enemies.
entries.sapphire: Sandshrew has a very dry hide that is extremely tough. The Pokémon can roll into a ball that repels any attack. At night, it burrows into the desert sand to sleep.
entries.emerald: When it curls up in a ball, it can make any attack bounce off harmlessly. Its hide has turned tough and solid as a result of living in the desert.
entries.firered: It burrows and lives underground. If threatened, it curls itself up into a ball for protection.
entries.leafgreen: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.
entries.diamond: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
entries.pearl: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
entries.platinum: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
entries.heartgold: If it fell from a great height, this Pokémon could save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.
entries.soulsilver: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.
entries.black: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
entries.white: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
entries.black2: It digs deep burrows to live in. When in danger, it rolls up its body to withstand attacks.
entries.white2: It digs deep burrows to live in. When in danger, it rolls up its body to withstand attacks.
entries.x: It burrows and lives underground. If threatened, it curls itself up into a ball for protection.
entries.y: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.
entries.omegaRuby: Sandshrew's body is configured to absorb water without waste, enabling it to survive in an arid desert. This Pokémon curls up to protect itself from its enemies.
entries.alphaSapphire: Sandshrew has a very dry hide that is extremely tough. The Pokémon can roll into a ball that repels any attack. At night, it burrows into the desert to sleep.
entries.sun: It can roll its body into a ball. It moves through the desert by rolling at high speeds.
entries.moon: It usually makes its home in deserts and arid zones, where rain does not fall. It digs holes to catch Bug-type Pokémon.
entries.ultraSun: It lives in areas of limited rainfall. When danger approaches, it curls up into a ball to protect its soft stomach.
entries.ultraMoon: When its skin gets wrinkled from moisture, it heads for a volcano. It lies flat on a spot with a lot of geothermal heat and dries itself out.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Its body is dry. When it gets cold at night, its hide is said to become coated with a fine dew.
entries.letsGoEevee: Its body is dry. When it gets cold at night, its hide is said to become coated with a fine dew.
entries.sword: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, this Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.
entries.shield: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to scatter them and then carries on digging.
entries.brilliantDiamond: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
entries.shiningPearl: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.

entries.sun: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard—so much so, it can't roll its body up into a ball.
entries.moon: An ancient tradition of Alolan festivals, still carried on to this day, is a competition to slide Sandshrew across ice as far as one can.
entries.ultraSun: After fleeing a volcanic eruption, it ended up moving to an area of snowy mountains. Its ice shell is as hard as steel.
entries.ultraMoon: The skin on its back is as hard as steel. Predators go after its soft belly, so it clings to the ground desperately.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Its ice-covered body lets it slide across the ground with bullet-like speed, sending its enemies flying when it hits them.
entries.letsGoEevee: Its ice-covered body lets it slide across the ground with bullet-like speed, sending its enemies flying when it hits them.
entries.sword: Life on mountains covered with deep snow has granted this Pokémon a body of ice that's as hard as steel.
entries.shield: It lives in snowy mountains on southern islands. When a blizzard rolls in, this Pokémon hunkers down in the snow to avoid getting blown away.

entries.red: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
entries.blue: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
entries.yellow: It is skilled at slashing enemies with its claws. If broken, they start to grow back in a day.
entries.stadium: Curls into a ball of sharp spikes and rolls into enemies. It is also adept at slashing with its sharp claws.
entries.gold: In an attempt to hide itself, it will run around at top speed to kick up a blinding dust storm.
entries.silver: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spikes and claws. They grow back in a day.
entries.crystal: Adept at climbing trees, it rolls into a spiny ball, then attacks its enemies from above.
entries.stadium2: In an attempt to hide itself, it will run around at top speed to kick up a blinding dust storm.
entries.ruby: Sandslash's body is covered by tough spikes, which are hardened sections of its hide. Once a year, the old spikes fall out, to be replaced with new spikes that grow out from beneath the old ones.
entries.sapphire: Sandslash can roll up its body as if it were a ball covered with large spikes. In battle, this Pokémon will try to make the foe flinch by jabbing it with its spines. It then leaps at the stunned foe to tear wildly with its sharp claws.
entries.emerald: It curls up in a ball to protect itself from enemy attacks. It also curls up to prevent heatstroke during the daytime when temperatures rise sharply.
entries.firered: It is adept at attacking with the spines on its back and its sharp claws while quickly scurrying about.
entries.leafgreen: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
entries.diamond: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.
entries.pearl: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.
entries.platinum: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.
entries.heartgold: In an attempt to hide itself, it will run around at top speed to kick up a blinding dust storm.
entries.soulsilver: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spike and claws. They grow back in a day.
entries.black: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.
entries.white: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.
entries.black2: The spikes on its body are made up of its hardened hide. It rolls up and attacks foes with its spikes.
entries.white2: The spikes on its body are made up of its hardened hide. It rolls up and attacks foes with its spikes.
entries.x: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spikes and claws. They grow back in a day.
entries.y: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
entries.omegaRuby: Sandslash's body is covered by tough spikes, which are hardened sections of its hide. Once a year, the old spikes fall out, to be replaced with new spikes that grow out from beneath the old ones.
entries.alphaSapphire: Sandslash can roll up its body as if it were a ball covered with large spikes. In battle, this Pokémon will try to make the foe flinch by jabbing it with its spines. It then leaps at the stunned foe to tear wildly with its sharp claws.
entries.sun: Although they are sharp, its claws and spikes often break off. They grow back the next day, so it is not bothered by the temporary loss.
entries.moon: It uses its claws to climb trees and then curls its body into a spiny ball, ready to drop onto any prey that appears.
entries.ultraSun: Its claws and horns often break off. The broken claws and horns can be used to carve plows for tilling farm fields.
entries.ultraMoon: Thanks to its thick claws, it's good at climbing trees. There are plenty of Sandslash that park themselves in trees and go right to sleep.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It is skilled at slashing enemies with its claws. If broken, they start to grow back in a day.
entries.letsGoEevee: It is skilled at slashing enemies with its claws. If broken, they start to grow back in a day.
entries.sword: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon's spikes feel when touched.
entries.shield: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.

entries.sun: Fleeing a volcanic eruption, it settled on a snowy mountain. As it races through the snowfields, it sends up a spray of snow.
entries.moon: This Pokémon's steel spikes are sheathed in ice. Stabs from these spikes cause deep wounds and severe frostbite as well.
entries.ultraSun: It runs across snow-covered plains at high speeds. It developed thick, sharp claws to plow through the snow.
entries.ultraMoon: A long, long time ago, it lived in the desert. With its sharp claws fully extended, it can climb right up an iceberg without slipping.
entries.letsGoPikachu: This is Sandslash's form after adaptation to a frigid environment. The cold air emitted by its body sharpens its icy spikes.
entries.letsGoEevee: This is Sandslash's form after adaptation to a frigid environment. The cold air emitted by its body sharpens its icy spikes.
entries.sword: It uses large, hooked claws to cut a path through deep snow as it runs. On snowy mountains, this Sandslash is faster than any other Pokémon.
