entries.silver: Its very sensitive ears let it distinguish distant sounds. As a result, it prefers quiet places.
entries.crystal: Said to live in quiet, remote mountains, this type of fairy has a strong aversion to being seen.
entries.stadium2: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.
entries.ruby: Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
entries.sapphire: Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
entries.emerald: A Clefable uses its wings to skip lightly as if it were flying. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. On quiet, moonlit nights, it strolls on lakes.
entries.firered: It has an acute sense of hearing. It can easily hear a pin being dropped nearly 1,100 yards away.
entries.leafgreen: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.
entries.diamond: Rarely seen by people, it is said to be drawn by the full moon to play at deserted lakes.
entries.pearl: Its hearing is so acute it can hear a pin drop over a half a mile. It lives on quiet mountains.
entries.platinum: It is very wary and rarely shows itself to people. Its ears can hear a pin drop over half a mile away.
entries.heartgold: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.
entries.soulsilver: Its very sensitive ears let it distinguish distant sounds. As a result, it prefers quiet places.
entries.black: It is very wary and rarely shows itself to people. Its ears can hear a pin drop over half a mile away.
entries.white: It is very wary and rarely shows itself to people. Its ears can hear a pin drop over half a mile away.
entries.black2: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.
entries.white2: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.
entries.x: Its hearing is so acute it can hear a pin drop over half a mile away. It lives on quiet mountains.
entries.y: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.
entries.omegaRuby: Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step even lets it walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
entries.alphaSapphire: Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step even lets it walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
entries.sun: They don't like to reveal themselves in front of people. They live quietly in packs deep in the mountains.
entries.moon: According to tradition, people who see a pair of Clefable skipping by can look forward to a happy marriage.
entries.ultraSun: It can't help but hear a pin drop from over half a mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains where there aren't many people or Pokémon.
entries.ultraMoon: Some scientists believe that it gazes intently at the sky on nights with a full moon because it's homesick.
entries.letsGoPikachu: They appear to be very protective of their own world. It is a kind of fairy, rarely seen by people.
entries.letsGoEevee: They appear to be very protective of their own world. It is a kind of fairy, rarely seen by people.
entries.sword: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.
entries.shield: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Rarely seen by people, it is said to be drawn by the full moon to play at deserted lakes.
entries.shiningPearl: Its hearing is so acute it can hear a pin drop over half a mile away. It lives on quiet mountains.
entries.legendsArceus: Legend says that on clear, quiet nights, it listens for the voices of its kin living on the moon. I, too, often think of my homeland, so far away.

entries.red: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
entries.blue: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
entries.yellow: Both its fur and its tails are beautiful. As it grows, the tails split and form more tails.
entries.stadium: A single, white-colored tail splits into six beautiful tails. As it grows older, it grows even more tails.
entries.gold: As it develops, its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.
entries.silver: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.
entries.crystal: As its body grows larger, its six warm tails become more beautiful, with a more luxurious coat of fur.
entries.stadium2: As it develops, its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.
entries.ruby: At the time of its birth, Vulpix has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this Pokémon receives plenty of love from its Trainer. The six tails become magnificently curled.
entries.sapphire: Inside Vulpix's body burns a flame that never goes out. During the daytime, when the temperatures rise, this Pokémon releases flames from its mouth to prevent its body from growing too hot.
entries.emerald: It can freely control fire, making fiery orbs fly like will-o'-the-wisps. Just before evolution, its six tails grow hot as if on fire.
entries.firered: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
entries.leafgreen: When it is born, it has just one snow-white tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
entries.diamond: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
entries.pearl: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
entries.platinum: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
entries.heartgold: As it develops, its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.
entries.soulsilver: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.
entries.black: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
entries.white: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
entries.black2: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.
entries.white2: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.
entries.x: When it is born, it has just one snow-white tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
entries.y: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
entries.omegaRuby: At the time of its birth, Vulpix has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this Pokémon receives plenty of love from its trainer. The six tails become magnificently curled.
entries.alphaSapphire: Inside Vulpix's body burns a flame that never goes out. During the daytime, when the temperatures rise, this Pokémon releases flames from its mouth to prevent its body from growing too hot.
entries.sun: Its beautiful fur and tails have made it very popular. As it grows, its tails split to form more tails.
entries.moon: From its mouth spew flames that seem to resemble the spirits of the deceased. Some people mistakenly think this fire is a ghost.
entries.ultraSun: Its beautiful tails have made it very popular. However, if it's not brushed diligently, it will be a mass of tangles before you know it.
entries.ultraMoon: It manipulates balls of fire to catch its prey. If you raise one from when it's young, it will grow close to you like a puppy Pokémon.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Both its fur and its tails are beautiful. As it grows, the tails split and form more tails.
entries.letsGoEevee: Both its fur and its tails are beautiful. As it grows, the tails split and form more tails.
entries.sword: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
entries.shield: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
entries.shiningPearl: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
entries.legendsArceus: In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of fireballs. When young, this Pokémon has but one white tail. As the Pokémon matures, this single tail splits into six.

entries.sun: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.
entries.moon: In hot weather, this Pokémon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.
entries.ultraSun: If you carelessly approach it because it's cute, the boss of the pack, Ninetales, will appear and freeze you.
entries.ultraMoon: They live together in a skulk, helping one another. Before eating their prey, they freeze it solid with their –58 degree Fahrenheit breath.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It looks like snow come to life, and the breath it exhales is –58 degrees Fahrenheit. Another name for it is Keokeo.
entries.letsGoEevee: It looks like snow come to life, and the breath it exhales is –58 degrees Fahrenheit. Another name for it is Keokeo.
entries.sword: After long years in the ever-snowcapped mountains of Alola, this Vulpix has gained power over ice.
entries.shield: If you observe its curly hairs through a microscope, you'll see small ice particles springing up.
entries.legendsArceus: These Pokémon live in packs in the snowy mountains and defend themselves with icy breath. I suspect this species changed its form to adapt to the frigid climate.

entries.red: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.
entries.blue: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.
entries.yellow: According to an enduring legend, 9 noble saints were united and reincarnated as this Pokémon.
entries.stadium: It is extremely vindictive. It is said to lay a 1,000-year long curse if its tail is pulled as a joke.
entries.gold: Some legends claim that each of its nine tails has its own unique type of special mystic power.
entries.silver: Its nine beautiful tails are filled with a wondrous energy that could keep it alive for 1,000 years.
entries.crystal: It is said to live a thousand years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.
entries.stadium2: Some legends claim that each of its nine tails has its own unique type of special mystic power.
entries.ruby: Ninetales casts a sinister light from its bright red eyes to gain total control over its foe's mind. This Pokémon is said to live for a thousand years.
entries.sapphire: Legend has it that Ninetales came into being when nine wizards possessing sacred powers merged into one. This Pokémon is highly intelligent - it can understand human speech.
entries.emerald: It has long been said that each of the nine tails embody an enchanted power. A long-lived Ninetales will have fur that shines like gold.
entries.firered: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
entries.leafgreen: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
entries.diamond: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.
entries.pearl: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.
entries.platinum: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.
entries.heartgold: Some legends claim that each of its nine tails has its own unique type of special mystic power.
entries.soulsilver: Its nine beautiful tails are filled with a wondrous energy that could keep it alive for 1,000 years.
entries.black: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.
entries.white: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.
entries.black2: Each of its nine tails is imbued with supernatural power, and it can live for a thousand years.
entries.white2: Each of its nine tails is imbued with supernatural power, and it can live for a thousand years.
entries.x: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
entries.y: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000 year curse.
entries.omegaRuby: Ninetales casts a sinister light from its bright red eyes to gain total control over its foe's mind. This Pokémon is said to live for one thousand years.
entries.alphaSapphire: Legend has it that Ninetales came into being when nine wizards possessing sacred powers merged into one. This Pokémon is highly intelligent—it can understand human speech.
entries.sun: Legend has it that this mystical Pokémon was formed when nine saints coalesced into one.
entries.moon: Said to live for a thousand years, this Pokémon uses its supernatural abilities to manipulate fire. It can burn its prey to a crisp as it pleases.
entries.ultraSun: It is vindictive and relentless by nature. Those who cross it even once will be cursed for a thousand years, along with their descendants.
entries.ultraMoon: The flickering flames it spews from its mouth leave its opponents hypnotized. Then, this extremely intelligent Pokémon attacks.
entries.letsGoPikachu: According to an enduring legend, nine noble saints were united and reincarnated as this Pokémon.
entries.letsGoEevee: According to an enduring legend, nine noble saints were united and reincarnated as this Pokémon.
entries.sword: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.
entries.shield: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. The Pokémon is said to live for 1,000 years.
entries.shiningPearl: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. The Pokémon is said to live for 1,000 years.
entries.legendsArceus: The coat of gleaming golden fur is quite magnificent. This species is said to store sacred power in its nine long tails and to live for a millennium.

entries.sun: It creates drops of ice in its coat and showers them over its enemies. Anyone who angers it will be frozen stiff in an instant.
entries.moon: Possessing a calm demeanor, this Pokémon was revered as a deity incarnate before it was identified as a regional variant of Ninetales.
entries.ultraSun: The reason it guides people all the way down to the mountain's base is that it wants them to hurry up and leave.
entries.ultraMoon: Some said that deities visited mountains where Ninetales live, so in times long past, no one was allowed to go into those mountains.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It lives on mountains perpetually covered in snow and is revered as a deity incarnate. It appears draped in a blizzard.
entries.letsGoEevee: It lives on mountains perpetually covered in snow and is revered as a deity incarnate. It appears draped in a blizzard.
entries.sword: A deity resides in the snowy mountains where this Pokémon lives. In ancient times, it was worshiped as that deity's incarnation.
entries.shield: While it will guide travelers who get lost on a snowy mountain down to the mountain's base, it won't forgive anyone who harms nature.
entries.legendsArceus: Dwells on sacred peaks perpetually covered in snow. Said to appear to virtuous people who have lost their way on mountain paths—it then guides them back down to the mountain's base.

entries.red: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
entries.blue: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
entries.yellow: Uses its alluring eyes to enrapture its foe. It then sings a pleasing melody that lulls the foe to sleep.
entries.stadium: It mesmerizes with its large, round eyes and sings a soothing melody. Pokémon hearing this song fall asleep.
entries.gold: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
entries.silver: Looking into its cute, round eyes causes it to sing a relaxing melody, inducing its enemies to sleep.
entries.crystal: It rolls its cute eyes as it sings a soothing lullaby. Its gentle song puts anyone who hears it to sleep.
entries.stadium2: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
entries.ruby: Jigglypuff's vocal chords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pokémon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.
entries.sapphire: When this Pokémon sings, it never pauses to breathe. If it is in a battle against an opponent that does not easily fall asleep, Jigglypuff cannot breathe, endangering its life.
entries.emerald: Nothing can avoid falling asleep hearing a Jigglypuff's song. The sound waves of its singing voice match the brain waves of someone in a deep sleep.
entries.firered: It captivates foes with its huge, round eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing a soothing melody.
entries.leafgreen: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
entries.diamond: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
entries.pearl: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
entries.platinum: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
entries.heartgold: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
entries.soulsilver: Looking into its cute, round eyes causes it to sing a relaxing melody, inducing its enemies to sleep.
entries.black: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
entries.white: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
entries.black2: Looking into its cute, round eyes makes it start singing a song so pleasant listeners can't help but fall asleep.
entries.white2: Looking into its cute, round eyes makes it start singing a song so pleasant listeners can't help but fall asleep.
entries.x: It captivates foes with its huge, round eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing a soothing melody.
entries.y: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
entries.omegaRuby: Jigglypuff's vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pokémon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.
entries.alphaSapphire: When this Pokémon sings, it never pauses to breathe. If it is in a battle against an opponent that does not easily fall asleep, Jigglypuff cannot breathe, endangering its life.
entries.sun: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, you'll become sleepy right away.
entries.moon: Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individual's singing skill depends on its own effort.
entries.ultraSun: Recordings of Jigglypuff's strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.
entries.ultraMoon: The songs they sing are totally different depending on the region they live in. Some even sound like they're shouting!
entries.letsGoPikachu: Uses its cute round eyes to enrapture its foe. It then sings a pleasing melody that lulls the foe to sleep.
entries.letsGoEevee: Uses its cute round eyes to enrapture its foe. It then sings a pleasing melody that lulls the foe to sleep.
entries.sword: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won't stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
entries.shield: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.
entries.brilliantDiamond: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
entries.shiningPearl: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.

entries.red: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.
entries.blue: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.
entries.yellow: Its body is full of elasticity. By inhaling deeply, it can continue to inflate itself without limit.
entries.stadium: Its soft and supple skin allows it to expand like a balloon. If it gets angry, it inhales and inflates itself steadily.
entries.gold: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won't want to be separated.
entries.silver: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a Body Slam.
entries.crystal: The rich, fluffy fur that covers its body feels so good that anyone who feels it can't stop touching it.
entries.stadium2: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won't want to be separated.
entries.ruby: Wigglytuff has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in this Pokémon's eyes, it is quickly washed away.
entries.sapphire: Wigglytuff's body is very flexible. By inhaling deeply, this Pokémon can inflate itself seemingly without end. Once inflated, Wigglytuff bounces along lightly like a balloon.
entries.emerald: Its fur is the ultimate in luxuriousness. Sleeping alongside a Wigglytuff is simply divine. Its body expands seemingly without end when it inhales.
entries.firered: Its fur is extremely fine, dense, and supple. The exquisitely pleasant fur conveys an image of luxury.
entries.leafgreen: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.
entries.diamond: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.
entries.pearl: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.
entries.platinum: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.
entries.heartgold: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won't want to be separated.
entries.soulsilver: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.
entries.black: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.
entries.white: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.
entries.black2: Its fine fur feels so pleasant, those who accidentally touch it cannot take their hands away.
entries.white2: Its fine fur feels so pleasant, those who accidentally touch it cannot take their hands away.
entries.x: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won't want to be separated.
entries.y: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.
entries.omegaRuby: Wigglytuff has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in this Pokémon's eyes, it is quickly washed away.
entries.alphaSapphire: Wigglytuff's body is very flexible. By inhaling deeply, this Pokémon can inflate itself seemingly without end. Once inflated, Wigglytuff bounces along lightly like a balloon.
entries.sun: It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change. The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn.
entries.moon: As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.
entries.ultraSun: Thanks to its bouncy body and fine fur, this Pokémon is sought after. Holding one in your arms while you sleep feels great.
entries.ultraMoon: When it gets angry, it inhales with all its might, and its body gradually inflates. Sometimes they can grow 20 times larger!
entries.letsGoPikachu: Its body is very elastic. By inhaling deeply, it can continue to inflate itself without limit.
entries.letsGoEevee: Its body is very elastic. By inhaling deeply, it can continue to inflate itself without limit.
entries.sword: The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.
entries.shield: It's proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that's perfectly heavenly.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.
entries.shiningPearl: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.

entries.red: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.
entries.blue: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.
entries.yellow: Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as a sonar used to check for objects in its way.
entries.stadium: It has neither eyes nor a nose. It emits ultrasonic cries that bounce back to its large ears, enabling it to fly safely.
entries.gold: While flying, it constantly emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings.
entries.silver: Capable of flying safely in dark places, it emits ultrasonic cries to check for any obstacles.
entries.crystal: During the day, it gathers with others and hangs from the ceilings of old buildings and caves.
entries.stadium2: While flying, it constantly emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings.
entries.ruby: Zubat remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright daylight hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the sun causes its body to become slightly burned.
entries.sapphire: Zubat avoids sunlight because exposure causes it to become unhealthy. During the daytime, it stays in caves or under the eaves of old houses, sleeping while hanging upside down.
entries.emerald: While living in pitch-black caverns, their eyes gradually grew shut and deprived them of vision. They use ultrasonic waves to detect obstacles.
entries.firered: It has no eyes. Instead, it relies on its ultrasonic cries for echo location to flit about in darkness.
entries.leafgreen: It forms colonies in perpetually dark places and uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.
entries.diamond: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from it mouth.
entries.pearl: Disliking sunlight, it sleeps deep in forests and caves until sundown.
entries.platinum: It checks its surroundings and location using reflections of the ultrasonic waves from its mouth.
entries.heartgold: While flying, it constantly emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings.
entries.soulsilver: Capable of flying safely in dark places, it emits ultrasonic cries to check for any obstacles.
entries.black: It checks its surroundings and location using reflections of the ultrasonic waves from its mouth.
entries.white: It checks its surroundings and location using reflections of the ultrasonic waves from its mouth.
entries.black2: It does not need eyes, because it emits ultrasonic waves to check its surroundings while it flies.
entries.white2: It does not need eyes, because it emits ultrasonic waves to check its surroundings while it flies.
entries.x: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from it mouth.
entries.y: It has no eyes. Instead, it relies on its ultrasonic cries for echolocation to flit about in darkness.
entries.omegaRuby: Zubat remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright daylight hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the sun causes its body to become slightly burned.
entries.alphaSapphire: Zubat avoids sunlight because exposure causes it to become unhealthy. During the daytime, it stays in caves or under the eaves of old houses, sleeping while hanging upside down.
entries.sun: It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes, so to check its surroundings while flying, it emits ultrasonic waves.
entries.moon: When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns. The frequency of their ultrasonic waves can differ slightly from colony to colony.
entries.ultraSun: It has no eyeballs, so it can't see. It checks its surroundings via the ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.
entries.ultraMoon: Their skin is so thin that they'll be burned if sunlight hits them. When it gets cold out, they gather together to warm one another's bodies.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as a sonar used to check for objects in its way.
entries.letsGoEevee: Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as a sonar used to check for objects in its way.
entries.sword: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.
entries.shield: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun's light won't reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.
entries.shiningPearl: Disliking sunlight, it sleeps deep in forests and caves until sundown.
entries.legendsArceus: Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this Pokémon blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that it emits from its mouth as it flies.

entries.red: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
entries.blue: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
entries.yellow: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and suck blood.
entries.stadium: Bites its prey and feeds on the victim's energy. Its own blood type changes to that of its victim.
entries.gold: However hard its victim's hide may be, it punctures with sharp fangs and gorges itself with blood.
entries.silver: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.
entries.crystal: When it plunges its fangs into its prey, it instantly draws and gulps down more than ten ounces of blood.
entries.stadium2: However hard its victim's hide may be, it punctures with sharp fangs and gorges itself with blood.
entries.ruby: Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night. This Pokémon flits around in the night skies, seeking fresh blood.
entries.sapphire: Golbat bites down on prey with its four fangs and drinks the victim's blood. It becomes active on inky dark moonless nights, flying around to attack people and Pokémon.
entries.emerald: Its fangs easily puncture even thick animal hide. It loves to feast on the blood of people and Pokémon. It flits about in darkness and strikes from behind.
entries.firered: It clamps down on its prey with needle-sharp fangs and drains over 10 ounces of blood in one gulp.
entries.leafgreen: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
entries.diamond: It loves the blood of humans and Pokémon. It flies around at night in search of neck veins.
entries.pearl: Once it starts sucking blood, it does not stop until it is full. It flies at night in search of prey.
entries.platinum: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.
entries.heartgold: However hard its victim's hide may be, it punctures with sharp fangs and gorges itself with blood.
entries.soulsilver: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.
entries.black: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.
entries.white: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.
entries.black2: Flitting around in the dead of night, it sinks its fangs into its prey and drains a nearly fatal amount of blood.
entries.white2: Flitting around in the dead of night, it sinks its fangs into its prey and drains a nearly fatal amount of blood.
entries.x: Once it bites, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
entries.y: Once it starts sucking blood, it does not stop until it is full. It flies at night in search of prey.
entries.omegaRuby: Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night. This Pokémon flits around in the night skies, seeking fresh blood.
entries.alphaSapphire: Golbat bites down on prey with its four fangs and drinks the victim's blood. It becomes active on inky dark moonless nights, flying around to attack people and Pokémon.
entries.sun: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.
entries.moon: Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can't fly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and become food for other Pokémon.
entries.ultraSun: Every once in a while, you'll see a Golbat that's missing some fangs. This happens when hunger drives it to try biting a Steel-type Pokémon.
entries.ultraMoon: They can suck down over 10 ounces of blood in one go. They have been known to drink so much blood that they can no longer fly.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and to suck blood.
entries.letsGoEevee: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and to suck blood.
entries.sword: It loves to drink other creatures' blood. It's said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it's gathered.
entries.shield: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It loves the blood of humans and Pokémon. It flies around at night in search of neck veins.
entries.shiningPearl: Once it starts sucking blood, it does not stop until it is full. It flies at night in search of prey.
entries.legendsArceus: It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow and akin to straws.

entries.red: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.
entries.blue: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.
entries.yellow: It may be mistaken for a clump of weeds. If you try to yank it out of the ground, it shrieks horribly.
entries.stadium: Burrows underground in the day, exposing only its leaves. It is said to scream loudly if anyone tries to yank it out.
entries.gold: Awakened by moonlight, it roams actively at night. In the day it stays quietly underground.
entries.silver: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
entries.crystal: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
entries.stadium2: Awakened by moonlight, it roams actively at night. In the day, it stays quietly underground.
entries.ruby: During the daytime, Oddish buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil, the glossier its leaves become.
entries.sapphire: Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokémon's feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.
entries.emerald: This Pokémon grows by absorbing moonlight. During the daytime, it buries itself in the ground, leaving only its leaves exposed to avoid detection by its enemies.
entries.firered: Its scientific name is "Oddium Wanderus." At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000 feet on its two roots.
entries.leafgreen: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.
entries.diamond: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.
entries.pearl: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.
entries.platinum: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

entries.red: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
entries.blue: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
entries.yellow: Smells incredibly foul! However, around 1 out of 1,000 people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
entries.stadium: The horrible-smelling pistil of this flower stinks over a mile away. Unwittingly inhaled, it can cause fainting.
entries.gold: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
entries.silver: It secretes a sticky, drool-like honey. Although sweet, it smells too repulsive to get very close.
entries.crystal: The smell from its drool-like syrup and the pollen on its petals is so bad, it may make opponents faint.
entries.stadium2: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
entries.ruby: Gloom releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger, the stench worsens. If this Pokémon is feeling calm and secure, it does not release its usual stinky aroma.
entries.sapphire: From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the noxious fumes and then drips even more of its honey.
entries.emerald: A horribly noxious honey drools from its mouth. One whiff of the honey can result in memory loss. Some fans are said to enjoy this overwhelming stink, however.
entries.firered: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.
entries.leafgreen: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
entries.diamond: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

entries.red: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
entries.blue: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
entries.yellow: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.
entries.stadium: Scatters allergy-causing pollen from its broad petals. The larger the petals, the more pollen is scattered.
entries.gold: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
entries.silver: The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen.
entries.crystal: By shaking its big petals, it scatters toxic pollen into the air, turning the air yellow.
entries.stadium2: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
entries.ruby: Vileplume's toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. That's why it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle, however pretty they may be.
entries.sapphire: Vileplume has the world's largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.
entries.emerald: In seasons when it produces more pollen, the air around a Vileplume turns yellow with the powder as it walks. The pollen is highly toxic and causes paralysis.
entries.firered: Its petals are the largest in the world. It fiendishly scatters allergy-causing pollen from its petals.
entries.leafgreen: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
entries.diamond: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

entries.red: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.
entries.blue: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.
entries.yellow: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
entries.stadium: Grows by sucking nutrients from the roots of trees. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing extracts from the bug host.
entries.gold: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.
entries.silver: As its body grows large, oriental mushrooms called tochukaso start sprouting out of its back.
entries.crystal: The tochukaso growing on this Pokémon's back orders it to extract juice from tree trunks.
entries.stadium2: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.
entries.ruby: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug/Grass Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
entries.sapphire: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug/Grass Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
entries.emerald: A Paras has parasitic tochukaso mushrooms growing on its back. They grow by drawing nutrients from the host. They are valued as a medicine for long life.
entries.firered: Growing out of the bug's back are mushrooms called tochukaso. The mushrooms grow with the bug host.
entries.leafgreen: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.
entries.diamond: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
entries.pearl: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
entries.platinum: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
entries.heartgold: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.
entries.soulsilver: As its body grows, large mushrooms named tochukaso start sprouting out of its back.
entries.black: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
entries.white: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
entries.black2: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
entries.white2: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
entries.x: Growing out of the bug's back are mushrooms called tochukaso. The mushrooms grow with the bug host.
entries.y: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
entries.omegaRuby: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
entries.alphaSapphire: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
entries.sun: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.
entries.moon: Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its back. They can be dried and powdered to make a medicine used to extend life.
entries.ultraSun: Whether it's due to a lack of moisture or a lack of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras don't grow up quite right.
entries.ultraMoon: The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
entries.letsGoEevee: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
entries.shiningPearl: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
entries.legendsArceus: Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests. The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.

entries.red: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.
entries.blue: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.
entries.yellow: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushrooms on its back. They appear to do all the thinking.
entries.stadium: The bug host is controlled by the mushrooms that scatter poisonous spores. The spores are sometimes used as medicine in China.
entries.gold: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mushrooms on its back.
entries.silver: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.
entries.crystal: When nothing's left to extract from the bug, the mushrooms on its back leave spores on the bug's egg.
entries.stadium2: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mushrooms on its back.
entries.ruby: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
entries.sapphire: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
entries.emerald: Parasect are known to infest the roots of large trees en masse and drain nutrients. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
entries.firered: It scatters toxic spores from the mushroom cap. In China, the spores are used as herbal medicine.
entries.leafgreen: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.
entries.diamond: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
entries.pearl: It is controlled by a mushroom grown larger than the bug body. It is said to prefer damp places.
entries.platinum: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
entries.heartgold: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mushrooms on its back.
entries.soulsilver: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.
entries.black: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
entries.white: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
entries.black2: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
entries.white2: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
entries.x: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
entries.y: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.
entries.omegaRuby: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
entries.alphaSapphire: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
entries.sun: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.
entries.moon: It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap. Once harvested, these spores can be steeped and boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.
entries.ultraSun: The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on its back having become the main body. If the mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.
entries.ultraMoon: Its poisonous spores are also used in traditional medicine. Apparently, spores produced in Alola are not of very good quality.
entries.letsGoPikachu: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushrooms on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.
entries.letsGoEevee: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushrooms on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Parasect is controlled by a mushroom that has grown larger than its host's body. The Pokémon scatters poisonous spores.
entries.shiningPearl: Parasect is controlled by a mushroom that has grown larger than its host's body. The Pokémon scatters poisonous spores.

entries.red: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.
entries.blue: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.
entries.yellow: Its large eyes act as radars. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
entries.stadium: Uses its large, radar-like eyes to move around in darkness. It is instinctively attracted to light.
entries.gold: Its eyes also function as radar units. It catches and eats small bugs that hide in darkness.
entries.silver: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches and eats small bugs at night that are attracted by light.
entries.crystal: The small bugs it eats appear only at night, so it sleeps in a hole in a tree until night falls.
entries.stadium2: Its eyes also function as radar units. It catches and eats small bugs that hide in darkness.
entries.ruby: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.
entries.sapphire: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.
entries.emerald: Its coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body is said to have evolved for protection. Its large eyes never fail to spot even miniscule prey.
entries.firered: Its eyes act as radar, enabling it to be active in darkness. The eyes can also shoot powerful beams.
entries.leafgreen: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.
entries.diamond: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

entries.red: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.
entries.blue: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.
entries.yellow: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
entries.stadium: The powder on its wings is poisonous. It scatters the powder with every flap, so you may be poisoned if you are downwind.
entries.gold: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.
entries.silver: The powder on its wings is poisonous if it is dark in color. If it is light, it causes paralysis.
entries.crystal: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.
entries.stadium2: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.
entries.ruby: Venomoth is nocturnal - it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
entries.sapphire: Venomoth is nocturnal - it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
entries.emerald: Venomoth are nocturnal — they only are active at night. Their favorite prey are insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
entries.firered: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
entries.leafgreen: The dustlike scales covering its wings are color-coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.
entries.diamond: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.
entries.pearl: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.
