entries.omegaRuby: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
entries.alphaSapphire: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
entries.letsGoPikachu: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
entries.letsGoEevee: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.
entries.shiningPearl: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.

entries.red: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.
entries.blue: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.
entries.yellow: It prefers dark places. It spends most of its time underground, though it may pop up in caves.
entries.stadium: Its head pokes up approximately eight inches out of the ground. However, its real size remains a mystery to this day.
entries.gold: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
entries.silver: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
entries.crystal: It digs underground and chews on tree roots, sticking its head out only when the sun isn't bright.
entries.stadium2: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
entries.ruby: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple - wherever this Pokémon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.
entries.sapphire: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple - wherever this Pokémon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.
entries.emerald: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple — wherever they burrow, the soil is left perfectly tilled for growing delicious crops.
entries.firered: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.
entries.leafgreen: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
entries.diamond: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
entries.pearl: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
entries.platinum: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
entries.heartgold: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
entries.soulsilver: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
entries.black: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
entries.white: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
entries.black2: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
entries.white2: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
entries.x: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
entries.y: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
entries.omegaRuby: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple—wherever this Pokémon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.
entries.alphaSapphire: Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple—wherever this Pokémon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.
entries.sun: It chews on plant roots underground. Farmers whose vegetables are vulnerable find it can be quite a pest.
entries.moon: Many farmers cherish and nurture Diglett because its droppings enrich the soil it lives in.
entries.ultraSun: It travels through tunnels that it digs underground. It hates sunlight, so it comes out only after the sun goes down.
entries.ultraMoon: Around their crops, farmers plant the kind of tree that Diglett like to eat as a way of getting Diglett to plow the fields for them.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It prefers dark places. It spends most of its time underground, though it may pop up in caves.
entries.letsGoEevee: It prefers dark places. It spends most of its time underground, though it may pop up in caves.
entries.sword: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
entries.shield: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.
entries.brilliantDiamond: This Pokémon lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
entries.shiningPearl: This Pokémon lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.

entries.sun: Its head sports an altered form of whiskers made of metal. When in communication with its comrades, its whiskers wobble to and fro.
entries.moon: Its golden hairs function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.
entries.ultraSun: Although it's powerful enough to dig right through volcanic rock, it doesn't allow itself to be seen very often.
entries.ultraMoon: The need to dig through volcanic rock in the ground has made them more powerful than the Diglett of other regions.
entries.letsGoPikachu: After living in soil with high iron content for some time, three steel whiskers sprouted from the top of its head.
entries.letsGoEevee: After living in soil with high iron content for some time, three steel whiskers sprouted from the top of its head.
entries.sword: The metal-rich geology of this Pokémon's habitat caused it to develop steel whiskers on its head.
entries.shield: Its three hairs change shape depending on Diglett's mood. They're a useful communication tool among these Pokémon.

entries.red: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
entries.blue: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
entries.yellow: A team of triplets that can burrow over 60 MPH. Due to this, some people think it's an earthquake.
entries.stadium: Diglett triplets that always travel together. Known to burrow more than 60 miles underground and trigger quakes.
entries.gold: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
entries.silver: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
entries.crystal: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it's like underground.
entries.stadium2: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
entries.ruby: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
entries.sapphire: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
entries.emerald: Because the triplets originally split from one body, they think exactly alike. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly through the ground.
entries.firered: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
entries.leafgreen: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
entries.diamond: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
entries.pearl: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
entries.platinum: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
entries.heartgold: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
entries.soulsilver: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
entries.black: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
entries.white: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
entries.black2: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
entries.white2: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
entries.x: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
entries.y: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
entries.omegaRuby: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
entries.alphaSapphire: Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
entries.sun: This set of triplets moves cooperatively. It's the power of teamwork that enables this Pokémon to dig to a depth of 60 miles.
entries.moon: Despite the closeness between this Pokémon and farmers and other people, no one has ever seen the parts of it concealed underground.
entries.ultraSun: While the three of them normally get along splendidly, on rare occasions a huge fight will break out over which head gets to eat first.
entries.ultraMoon: Dugtrio's heads are sleek and smooth and incredibly hard. It can dig through any soil with its headbutts.
entries.letsGoPikachu: A team of triplets that can burrow to a depth of 60 miles. It's reported that this triggers an earthquake.
entries.letsGoEevee: A team of triplets that can burrow to a depth of 60 miles. It's reported that this triggers an earthquake.
entries.sword: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
entries.shield: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it's like underground.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
entries.shiningPearl: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.

entries.sun: Its shining gold hair provides it with protection. It's reputed that keeping any of its fallen hairs will bring bad luck.
entries.moon: These Pokémon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.
entries.ultraSun: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it's not very fast, but it has the power to dig through bedrock.
entries.ultraMoon: Its shining gold whiskers are advanced sensors that can detect vibrations from sounds several miles away.
entries.letsGoPikachu: They're referred to as triplets, but they're not identical–the metallic elements in their bodies differ slightly. The proof shows in their whiskers!
entries.letsGoEevee: They're referred to as triplets, but they're not identical–the metallic elements in their bodies differ slightly. The proof shows in their whiskers!
entries.sword: Their beautiful, metallic whiskers create a sort of protective helmet on their heads, and they also function as highly precise sensors.
entries.shield: The three of them get along very well. Through their formidable teamwork, they defeat powerful opponents.

entries.red: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
entries.blue: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
entries.yellow: Appears to be more active at night. It loves round and shiny things. It can't stop from picking them up.
entries.stadium: Sleeps in the daytime. At night, its eyes glow as it happily collects coins, its favorite things.
entries.gold: It is fascinated by round objects. It can't stop playing with them until it tires and falls asleep.
entries.silver: It loves anything that shines. It especially adores coins that it picks up and secretly hoards.
entries.crystal: It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines too.
entries.stadium2: It is fascinated with round objects. It can't stop playing with them until it tires and falls asleep.
entries.ruby: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
entries.sapphire: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
entries.emerald: Meowth withdraw their sharp claws into their paws to silently sneak about. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
entries.firered: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.
entries.leafgreen: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
entries.diamond: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
entries.pearl: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
entries.platinum: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
entries.heartgold: It is fascinated by round objects. It can't stop playing with them until it tires and falls asleep.
entries.soulsilver: It loves anything that shines. It especially adores coins that it picks up and secretly hoards.
entries.black: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
entries.white: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
entries.black2: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
entries.white2: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
entries.x: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
entries.y: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
entries.omegaRuby: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
entries.alphaSapphire: Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
entries.sun: It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk. At night, it wanders the city in search of loose change.
entries.moon: It loves shiny things. It often fights with Murkrow over prey they're both trying to catch.
entries.ultraSun: When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight of it having an intense fight with Murkrow over shiny objects.
entries.ultraMoon: It loves coins, so if you give it one, you can make friends with Meowth easily. But it's fickle, so you can't count on that friendship lasting.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Appears to be more active at night. It loves round and shiny things. It can't stop itself from picking them up.
entries.letsGoEevee: Appears to be more active at night. It loves round and shiny things. It can't stop itself from picking them up.
entries.sword: It loves to collect shiny things. If it's in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.
entries.shield: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn't get along with Galarian Meowth.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It is nocturnal by nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter as brightly as the shiny object.
entries.shiningPearl: It is nocturnal by nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter as brightly as the shiny object.

entries.sun: This Pokémon was not originally found in Alola. Human actions caused a surge in their numbers, and they went feral. They're prideful and crafty.
entries.moon: When its delicate pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.
entries.ultraSun: It's impulsive, selfish, and fickle. It's very popular with some Trainers who like giving it the attention it needs.
entries.ultraMoon: A royal house that flourished in the distant past brought it here from another region. Meowth is both selfish and prideful.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Highly intelligent and prideful, it's famously difficult to handle–but that's also a reason for its popularity.
entries.letsGoEevee: Highly intelligent and prideful, it's famously difficult to handle–but that's also a reason for its popularity.
entries.sword: It's accustomed to luxury because it used to live with Alolan royalty. As a result, it's very picky about food.
entries.shield: Deeply proud and keenly smart, this Pokémon moves with cunning during battle and relentlessly attacks enemies' weak points.

entries.sword: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.
entries.shield: These daring Pokémon have coins on their foreheads. Darker coins are harder, and harder coins garner more respect among Meowth.

entries.sword: The pattern that has appeared on its giant coin is thought to be the key to unlocking the secrets of the Dynamax phenomenon.
entries.shield: Its body has grown incredibly long and the coin on its forehead has grown incredibly large—all thanks to Gigantamax power.

entries.red: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
entries.blue: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
entries.yellow: The gem in its forehead glows on its own! It walks with all the grace and elegance of a proud queen.
entries.stadium: It is highly regarded as a pet for its beautiful fur. However, it is extremely temperamental and difficult to keep.
entries.gold: Many adore it for its sophisticated air. However, it will lash out and scratch for little reason.
entries.silver: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
entries.crystal: Behind its lithe, elegant appearance lies a barbaric side. It will tear apart its prey on a mere whim.
entries.stadium2: Many adore it for its sophisticated air. However, it will lash out and scratch for little reason.
entries.ruby: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokémon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
entries.sapphire: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokémon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
entries.emerald: A Persian's six bold whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in its vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
entries.firered: Has a vicious temperament. Beware if it raises its tail straight up. It is a signal that it is about to pounce and bite.
entries.leafgreen: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
entries.diamond: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
entries.pearl: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
entries.platinum: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
entries.heartgold: Many adore it for its sophisticated air. However, it will lash out and scratch for little reason.
entries.soulsilver: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
entries.black: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
entries.white: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
entries.black2: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
entries.white2: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
entries.x: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
entries.y: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
entries.omegaRuby: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokémon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
entries.alphaSapphire: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokémon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
entries.sun: It has a violent temperament. It will attack anything that looks it in the eye. Its sharp claws inflict deep wounds.
entries.moon: It has a high opinion of itself, although not to the same extent as the Alolan Persian. It's quite difficult to make friends with this Pokémon.
entries.ultraSun: Although the jewel on its forehead appears to be a different color than those of Alolan Persian, it's mostly made of the same material.
entries.ultraMoon: This Pokémon is popular with rich people. It's also targeted by hunters who are after the jewel in its forehead.
entries.letsGoPikachu: The gem in its forehead glows on its own! It walks with all the grace and elegance of a proud queen.
entries.letsGoEevee: The gem in its forehead glows on its own! It walks with all the grace and elegance of a proud queen.
entries.sword: Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.
entries.shield: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It is a very haughty Pokémon. Among fans of Persian, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
entries.shiningPearl: It is a very haughty Pokémon. Among fans of Persian, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

entries.sun: Its round face and smooth coat—softer than the most high-class velvet—have made this a very popular Pokémon in Alola.
entries.moon: It looks down on everyone other than itself. Its preferred tactics are sucker punches and blindside attacks.
entries.ultraSun: In contrast to its lovely face, it's so brutal that it tortures its weakened prey rather than finishing them off.
entries.ultraMoon: Its round face is a symbol of wealth. Persian that have bigger, plumper faces are considered more beautiful.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It has the classiest coat. The rippling of its fur in the heat of battle has a beauty all its own.
entries.letsGoEevee: It has the classiest coat. The rippling of its fur in the heat of battle has a beauty all its own.
entries.sword: The round face of Alolan Persian is considered to be a symbol of prosperity in the Alola region, so these Pokémon are very well cared for.
entries.shield: This Pokémon is one tough opponent. Not only does it have formidable physical abilities, but it's also not above fighting dirty.

entries.red: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.
entries.blue: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.
entries.yellow: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but it is not known if it intends to do so.
entries.stadium: Appears unaware and totally vacant. However, if its chronic headache worsens, it starts exhibiting peculiar powers.
entries.gold: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
entries.silver: If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.
entries.crystal: The only time it can use its psychic power is when its sleeping brain cells happen to wake.
entries.stadium2: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
entries.ruby: Psyduck uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this Pokémon generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy among scholars.
entries.sapphire: If it uses its mysterious power, Psyduck can't remember having done so. It apparently can't form a memory of such an event because it goes into an altered state that is much like deep sleep.
entries.emerald: When its headache intensifies, it starts using strange powers. However, it has no recollection of its powers, so it always looks befuddled and bewildered.
entries.firered: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
entries.leafgreen: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.
entries.diamond: If its usual headache worsens, it starts exhibiting odd powers. It can't remember doing so, however.
entries.pearl: It never remembers using its odd powers, so it always tilts its head in puzzlement.
entries.platinum: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.
entries.heartgold: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
entries.soulsilver: If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.
entries.black: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.
entries.white: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.
entries.black2: When headaches stimulate its brain cells, which are usually inactive, it can use a mysterious power.
entries.white2: When headaches stimulate its brain cells, which are usually inactive, it can use a mysterious power.
entries.x: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
entries.y: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
entries.omegaRuby: Psyduck uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this Pokémon generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy among scholars.
entries.alphaSapphire: If it uses its mysterious power, Psyduck can't remember having done so. It apparently can't form a memory of such an event because it goes into an altered state that is much like deep sleep.
entries.sun: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.
entries.moon: This Pokémon is troubled by constant headaches. The more pain it's in, the more powerful its psychokinesis becomes.
entries.ultraSun: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.
entries.ultraMoon: It has been found that its brain cells are 10 times more active when Psyduck is experiencing a headache.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but whether it intends to do so is not known.
entries.letsGoEevee: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but whether it intends to do so is not known.
entries.sword: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.
entries.shield: As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.
entries.brilliantDiamond: If its usual headache worsens, it starts exhibiting odd powers. It can't remember doing so, however.
entries.shiningPearl: It never remembers using its odd powers, so it always tilts its head in puzzlement.
entries.legendsArceus: Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great, Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent. Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.

entries.red: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.
entries.blue: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.
entries.yellow: Its slim and long limbs end in broad flippers. They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.
entries.stadium: Its webbed hands and feet make it a proficient swimmer. May be seen swimming elegantly at dusk in places like lakes.
entries.gold: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
entries.silver: It appears by waterways at dusk. It may use telekinetic powers if its forehead glows mysteriously.
entries.crystal: It swims gracefully along on the quiet, slow-moving rivers and lakes of which it is so fond.
entries.stadium2: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
entries.ruby: The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the streamlined body of Golduck give it frightening speed. This Pokémon is definitely much faster than even the most athletic swimmer.
entries.sapphire: Golduck is the fastest swimmer among all Pokémon. It swims effortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues people from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
entries.emerald: A Golduck is an adept swimmer. It sometimes joins competitive swimmers in training. It uses psychic powers when its forehead shimmers with light.
entries.firered: The forelegs are webbed, helping to make it an adept swimmer. It can be seen swimming elegantly in lakes, etc.
entries.leafgreen: Often seen swimming elegantly by lakeshores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster Kappa.
entries.diamond: A Pokémon that lives in lakes. It swims faster than any human swimming champion.
entries.pearl: The flippers of its well-developed limbs give it shocking speed. It is the best swimmer among Pokémon.
entries.platinum: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.
entries.heartgold: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
entries.soulsilver: It appears by waterways at dusk. It may use telekinetic powers if its forehead glows mysteriously.
entries.black: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.
entries.white: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.
entries.black2: When its forehead shines mysteriously, Golduck can use the full extent of its power.
entries.white2: When its forehead shines mysteriously, Golduck can use the full extent of its power.
entries.x: It appears by waterways at dusk. It may use telekinetic powers if its forehead glows mysteriously.
entries.y: The forelegs are webbed, helping to make it an adept swimmer. It can be seen swimming elegantly in lakes, etc.
entries.omegaRuby: The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the streamlined body of Golduck give it frightening speed. The Pokémon is definitely much faster than even the most athletic swimmer.
entries.alphaSapphire: Golduck is the fastest swimmer among all Pokémon. It swims effortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues people from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
entries.sun: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who possess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.
entries.moon: It swims along the banks of lakes and catches fish Pokémon. It takes them to the shore and quietly eats them up.
entries.ultraSun: Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a standstill and seizes them.
entries.ultraMoon: A professional swimmer, it can continue swimming for two days straight by waving its long tail skillfully.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Its long, slim limbs end in broad flippers. They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.
entries.letsGoEevee: Its long, slim limbs end in broad flippers. They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.
entries.sword: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.
entries.shield: Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into the water and taken away.
entries.brilliantDiamond: This Pokémon lives in lakes. It swims faster than any world-class swimmer.
entries.shiningPearl: The flippers of its well-developed limbs give it shocking speed. It is the best swimmer among Pokémon.

entries.red: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.
entries.blue: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.
entries.yellow: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
entries.stadium: Quick to anger, it will begin brawling on the slightest provocation. It is unsafe to approach as it is very nimble.
entries.gold: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.
entries.silver: It's unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can't distinguish friends from foes.
entries.crystal: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.
entries.stadium2: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.
entries.ruby: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
entries.sapphire: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
entries.emerald: When it starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign of anger. However, since this happens instantly, there is no time to flee.
entries.firered: Light and agile on its feet, and ferocious in temperament. When angered, it flies into an uncontrollable frenzy.
entries.leafgreen: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.
entries.diamond: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

entries.sun: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
entries.moon: Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep, but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it to wake up—which infuriates it all over again.
entries.ultraSun: The smallest of things could cause it to lose its temper. Because it doesn't hold in its stress, this Pokémon can live a long time.
entries.ultraMoon: If one gets angry, all the others around it will get angry, so silence is a rare visitor in a troop of Mankey.

entries.letsGoEevee: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

entries.shiningPearl: It lives in treetop colonies. If one member of the group becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

entries.red: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.
entries.blue: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.
entries.yellow: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
entries.stadium: When enraged, it gives chase endlessly. Because it is impossible to tell what made it angry, there is no soothing it.
entries.gold: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.
entries.silver: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
entries.crystal: It will beat up anyone who makes it mad, even if it has to chase them until the end of the world.
entries.stadium2: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.

entries.sapphire: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
entries.emerald: When it becomes furious, its blood circulation becomes more robust, and its muscles are made stronger. But it also becomes much less intelligent.
entries.firered: It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase, it will tenaciously track the target no matter how far.
entries.leafgreen: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it catches up.

entries.ultraMoon: The blood vessels in its brain are sturdier than those of other Pokémon, so it can stay healthy despite its constant raging.

entries.legendsArceus: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.

entries.red: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.
entries.blue: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.
entries.yellow: The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by area. It is more adept at swimming than walking.
entries.stadium: The spiral on its belly is its internal organs seen through its thin skin. It is better at swimming than walking.
entries.gold: Because it is inept at walking on its newly grown legs, it always swims around in water.
entries.silver: The direction of its belly spiral differs by area. The equator is thought to have an effect on this.

entries.omegaRuby: Poliwrath's highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pokémon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.
entries.alphaSapphire: Poliwrath's highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pokémon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.
entries.sun: Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
entries.moon: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.
entries.ultraSun: It's quite a gifted swimmer, even among Water-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its time on land.
entries.ultraMoon: The muscles it has developed through swimming are thick and powerful. When it lands a square punch, it can turn huge boulders to dust.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.
entries.letsGoEevee: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.
entries.sword: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
entries.shield: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.
entries.brilliantDiamond: With its extremely tough muscles, it could keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
entries.shiningPearl: With its extremely tough muscles, it could keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

entries.red: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and Teleport to safety.
entries.blue: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and Teleport to safety.
entries.yellow: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
entries.stadium: Even while asleep, it can sense enemies approaching. It Teleports itself to a distant spot if there is any danger.
entries.gold: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
entries.silver: If it decides to teleport randomly, it creates the illusion that it has created copies of itself.
entries.crystal: It hypnotizes itself so that it can teleport away when it senses danger, even if it is asleep.
entries.stadium2: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
entries.ruby: Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this Pokémon immediately teleports to safety.
entries.sapphire: Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn't, this Pokémon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.
entries.emerald: A Pokémon that sleeps 18 hours a day. Observation revealed that it uses Teleport to change its location once every hour.
entries.firered: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of extrasensory powers even while asleep.
entries.leafgreen: Using its ability to read minds, it will sense impending danger and Teleport to safety.
entries.diamond: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. Even when awake, it teleports itself while remaining seated.
entries.pearl: Even while asleep, it maintains a telepathic radar. It teleports when it is threatened.
entries.platinum: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
entries.heartgold: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
entries.soulsilver: If it decides to teleport randomly, it evokes the illusion that it has created copies of itself.
entries.black: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
entries.white: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
entries.black2: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
entries.white2: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
entries.x: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of extrasensory powers even while asleep.
entries.y: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
entries.omegaRuby: Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this Pokémon immediately teleports to safety.
entries.alphaSapphire: Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn't, this Pokémon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.
entries.sun: It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping, it will teleport itself to treetops and pick and eat berries there.
entries.moon: It can teleport itself to safety while it's asleep, but when it wakes, it doesn't know where it is, so it panics.
entries.ultraSun: It uses various psychic powers even while it's sleeping, so you can't tell whether or not it's awake.
entries.ultraMoon: It can read others' minds and will teleport away when danger approaches. You must clear your mind if you want to catch it.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
entries.letsGoEevee: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
entries.sword: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra's dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
entries.shield: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. Even when awake, it teleports itself while remaining seated.
entries.shiningPearl: Even while asleep, it maintains a telepathic radar. It teleports when it is threatened.
entries.legendsArceus: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the Pokémon will simply teleport away.

entries.red: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.
entries.blue: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.
entries.yellow: Many odd things happen if this Pokémon is close by. For example, it makes clocks run backwards.
entries.stadium: When it uses psychic power, all its brain cells work in unison to generate powerful alpha waves.
entries.gold: It possesses strong spiritual power. The more danger it faces, the stronger its psychic power.
entries.silver: If it uses its abilities, it emits special alpha waves that cause machines to malfunction.
entries.crystal: When it closes its eyes, twice as many alpha particles come out of the surface of its body.
entries.stadium2: It possesses strong spiritual power. The more danger it faces, the stronger its psychic power.
entries.ruby: Kadabra emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope to become a Trainer of this Pokémon.
entries.sapphire: Kadabra holds a silver spoon in its hand. The spoon is used to amplify the alpha waves in its brain. Without the spoon, the Pokémon is said to be limited to half the usual amount of its telekinetic powers.
entries.emerald: It is rumored that a boy with psychic abilities suddenly transformed into Kadabra while he was assisting research into extrasensory powers.
entries.firered: It happened one morning - a boy with extrasensory powers awoke in bed transformed into Kadabra.
entries.leafgreen: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close.
entries.diamond: If one is nearby, an eerie shadow appears on TV screens. Seeing the shadow is said to bring bad luck.
entries.pearl: When it uses its psychic power, it emits strong alpha waves that can ruin precision devices.
entries.platinum: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.
entries.heartgold: It possesses strong spiritual power. The more danger it faces, the stronger its psychic power.
entries.soulsilver: If it uses its abilities, it emits special alpha waves that cause machines to malfunction.
entries.black: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.
entries.white: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.
entries.black2: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.
entries.white2: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.
entries.x: When it uses its psychic power, it emits strong alpha waves that can ruin precision devices.
entries.y: If it uses its abilities, it emits special alpha waves that cause machines to malfunction.
entries.omegaRuby: Kadabra emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope to become a trainer of this Pokémon.
entries.alphaSapphire: Kadabra holds a silver spoon in its hand. The spoon is used to amplify the alpha waves in its brain. Without the spoon, the Pokémon is said to be limited to half the usual amount of its telekinetic powers.
entries.sun: A theory exists that this Pokémon was a young boy who couldn't control his psychic powers and ended up transformed into this Pokémon.
entries.moon: Kadabra's presence infests televisions and monitors with creepy shadows that bring bad luck.
entries.ultraSun: It stares at a silver spoon to amplify its psychic powers before it lets loose. Apparently, gold spoons are no good.
entries.ultraMoon: It possesses strong mental capabilities, but its psychic powers are halved when it's not holding a silver spoon.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Many odd things happen if this Pokémon is close by. For example, it makes clocks run backward.
entries.letsGoEevee: Many odd things happen if this Pokémon is close by. For example, it makes clocks run backward.
entries.sword: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
entries.shield: This Pokémon's telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.
entries.brilliantDiamond: If one is nearby, an eerie shadow appears on TV screens. Seeing the shadow is said to bring bad luck.
entries.shiningPearl: When it uses its psychic power, it emits strong alpha waves that can ruin precision instruments.
entries.legendsArceus: There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.

entries.red: Its brain can outperform a super-computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.
entries.blue: Its brain can outperform a super-computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.
entries.yellow: A Pokémon that can memorize anything. It never forgets what it learns—that's why this Pokémon is smart.
entries.stadium: A Pokémon that uses psychic power. It is highly intelligent and capable of instantly identifying its foe's weakness.
entries.gold: Closing both its eyes heightens all its other senses. This enables it to use its abilities to their extremes.
entries.silver: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
entries.crystal: It has an IQ of 5000. It calculates many things in order to gain the edge in every battle.
entries.stadium2: Closing both its eyes heightens all its other senses. This enables it to use its abilities to their extremes.
entries.ruby: Alakazam's brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck. This Pokémon holds its head up using its psychokinetic power instead.
entries.sapphire: Alakazam's brain continually grows, infinitely multiplying brain cells. This amazing brain gives this Pokémon an astoundingly high IQ of 5,000. It has a thorough memory of everything that has occurred in the world.
entries.emerald: While it has strong psychic abilities and high intelligence, an Alakazam's muscles are very weak. It uses psychic power to move its body.
entries.firered: It does not like physical attacks very much. Instead, it freely uses extra-sensory powers to defeat foes.
entries.leafgreen: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its IQ (intelligence quotient) is said to be around 5,000.
entries.diamond: Its superb memory lets it recall everything it has experienced from birth. Its IQ exceeds 5,000.
entries.pearl: Its highly developed brain is on par with a supercomputer. It can use all forms of psychic abilities.
entries.platinum: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
entries.heartgold: Closing both its eyes heightens all its other senses. This enables it to use its abilities to their extremes.
entries.soulsilver: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
entries.black: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
entries.white: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
entries.black2: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
entries.white2: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
entries.x: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
entries.y: Its brain can outperform a super-computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.
entries.omegaRuby: Alakazam's brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck. This Pokémon holds its head up using its psychokinetic power instead.
entries.alphaSapphire: Alakazam's brain continually grows, infinitely multiplying brain cells. This amazing brain gives this Pokémon an astoundingly high IQ of 5,000. It has a thorough memory of everything that has occurred in the world.
entries.sun: It is said to have an IQ of approximately 5,000. Its overflowing psychokinetic powers cause headaches to anyone nearby.
entries.moon: Its brain cells continue to increase in number until its death. The older the Alakazam, the larger its head.
entries.ultraSun: Alakazam uses its psychic powers to make the spoons it carries. Each spoon is an original that there's only one of in the whole world.
entries.ultraMoon: If it trusts someone deeply, it will let them have one of its spoons. Anything you eat with that spoon is apparently delicious.
entries.letsGoPikachu: A Pokémon that can memorize anything. It never forgets what it learns—that's why this Pokémon is smart.
entries.letsGoEevee: A Pokémon that can memorize anything. It never forgets what it learns—that's why this Pokémon is smart.
entries.sword: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
entries.shield: Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It's said that this Pokémon used these powers to create the spoons it holds.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Its superb memory lets it recall everything it has experienced from birth. Its IQ exceeds 5,000.
entries.shiningPearl: Its highly developed brain is on par with a supercomputer. It can use all forms of psychic abilities.
entries.legendsArceus: The longer Alakazam lives, the larger and heavier its head becomes. Our tests have shown that the strength of its psychic powers correlates positively to the weight of its head.

entries.sun: As a result of Mega Evolution, its power has been entirely converted into psychic energy, and it has lost all strength in its muscles.
entries.moon: Its hidden psychic power has been unleashed. A glance at someone gives it knowledge of the course of that person's life, from birth to death.
entries.ultraSun: It sends out psychic power from the red organ on its forehead to foresee its opponents' every move.
entries.ultraMoon: Having traded away its muscles, Alakazam's true power has been unleashed. With its psychic powers, it can foresee all things.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It's adept at precognition. When attacks completely miss Alakazam, that's because it's seeing the future.
entries.letsGoEevee: It's adept at precognition. When attacks completely miss Alakazam, that's because it's seeing the future.

entries.red: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.
entries.blue: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.
entries.yellow: Very powerful in spite of its small size. Its mastery of many types of martial arts makes it very tough.
entries.stadium: Its whole body is covered with muscles, so it can raise bulges anywhere. It can throw a hundred adults.
entries.gold: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
entries.silver: It loves to work out and build its muscles. It is never satisfied, even if it trains hard all day long.
entries.crystal: It trains by lifting rocks in the mountains. It can even pick up a Graveler with ease.
entries.stadium2: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
entries.ruby: Machop's muscles are special - they never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise. This Pokémon has sufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.
entries.sapphire: Machop exercises by hefting around a Graveler as if it were a barbell. There are some Machop that travel the world in a quest to master all kinds of martial arts.
entries.emerald: It continually undertakes strenuous training to master all forms of martial arts. Its strength lets it easily hoist a sumo wrestler onto its shoulders.
entries.firered: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
entries.leafgreen: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.
entries.diamond: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.
entries.pearl: Its muscles never cramp however much it trains. It lives in the mountains away from humans.
entries.platinum: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.
entries.heartgold: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
entries.soulsilver: It loves to work out and build its muscles. It is never satisfied, even if it trains hard all day long.
entries.black: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.
entries.white: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.
entries.black2: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.
entries.white2: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.
entries.x: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.
entries.y: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
entries.omegaRuby: Machop's muscles are special—they never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise. This Pokémon has sufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.
entries.alphaSapphire: Machop exercises by hefting around a Graveler as if it were a barbell. There are some Machop that travel the world in a quest to master all kinds of martial arts.
entries.sun: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.
entries.moon: With its superhuman strength, it's able to throw a hundred people all at the same time. Its strength comes from lifting Graveler every day.
entries.ultraSun: Once this Pokémon has gained enough confidence and muscle from training with its friends, it challenges Makuhita to a battle.
entries.ultraMoon: It likes food that's highly nutritious because its instincts drive it to build muscle efficiently.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Very powerful in spite of its small size. Its mastery of many types of martial arts makes it very tough.
entries.letsGoEevee: Very powerful in spite of its small size. Its mastery of many types of martial arts makes it very tough.
entries.sword: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
entries.shield: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.
entries.shiningPearl: Its muscles never cramp however much it trains. It lives in the mountains away from humans.
entries.legendsArceus: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.

entries.red: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
entries.blue: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
entries.yellow: The belt around its waist holds back its energy. Without it, this Pokémon would be unstoppable.
entries.stadium: Although it is incredibly strong, it is always modest. It restrains its strength with a power-save belt.
entries.gold: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable Pokémon never gets tired.
entries.silver: The muscles covering its body teem with power. Even when still, it exudes an amazing sense of strength.
entries.crystal: This tough Pokémon always stays in the zone. Its muscles become thicker after every battle.
entries.stadium2: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable Pokémon never gets tired.
entries.ruby: Machoke's thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel. This Pokémon has so much strength, it can easily hold aloft a sumo wrestler on just one finger.
entries.sapphire: Machoke undertakes bodybuilding every day even as it helps people with tough, physically demanding labor. On its days off, this Pokémon heads to the fields and mountains to exercise and train.
entries.emerald: A belt is worn by a Machoke to keep its overwhelming power under control. Because it is so dangerous, no one has ever removed the belt.
entries.firered: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.
entries.leafgreen: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
entries.diamond: Machoke's boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.
entries.pearl: It can lift a dump truck with one hand. Using that power, it helps people with heavy jobs.
entries.platinum: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.
entries.heartgold: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable Pokémon never gets tired.
entries.soulsilver: The muscles covering its body teem with power. Even when still, it exudes an amazing sense of strength.
entries.black: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.
entries.white: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.
entries.black2: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.
entries.white2: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.
entries.x: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
entries.y: It can lift a dump truck with one hand. Using that power, it helps people with heavy jobs.
entries.omegaRuby: Machoke's thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel. This Pokémon has so much strength, it can easily hold aloft a sumo wrestler on just one finger.
entries.alphaSapphire: Machoke undertakes bodybuilding every day even as it helps people with tough, physically demanding labor. On its days off, this Pokémon heads to the fields and mountains to exercise and train.
entries.sun: As a result of its continual workouts, it has developed tremendous power. It uses that power to help people with their work.
entries.moon: It willingly assists with hard labor because it knows the work is good training for its muscles.
entries.ultraSun: When it encounters an enemy that's truly mighty, this Pokémon removes the power-save belt from its waist and unleashes its full power.
entries.ultraMoon: A popular motif for sculptures, its incredibly well-developed muscles have captured the imagination of many an artist.
entries.letsGoPikachu: The belt around its waist holds back its energy. Without it, this Pokémon would be unstoppable.
entries.letsGoEevee: The belt around its waist holds back its energy. Without it, this Pokémon would be unstoppable.
entries.sword: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
entries.shield: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Machoke's boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.
entries.shiningPearl: It can lift a dump truck with one hand. Using that kind of strength, it helps people do heavy jobs.
entries.legendsArceus: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.

entries.red: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
entries.blue: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
entries.yellow: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pokémon fires off awesome punches.
entries.stadium: Among its fighting moves is a simultaneous volley of an uppercut, hook, straight and Karate Chop from its four arms.
entries.gold: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
entries.silver: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
entries.crystal: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
entries.stadium2: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
entries.ruby: Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This Pokémon tends to leap into action before it thinks.
entries.sapphire: Machamp is known as the Pokémon that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.
entries.emerald: It is impossible to defend against punches and chops doled out by its four arms. Its fighting spirit flares up when it faces a tough opponent.
entries.firered: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.
entries.leafgreen: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
entries.diamond: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
entries.pearl: It can knock a train flying with a punch. However, it is terrible at delicate work using its fingers.
entries.platinum: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
entries.heartgold: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
entries.soulsilver: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
entries.black: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
entries.white: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
entries.black2: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
entries.white2: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
entries.x: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.
entries.y: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
entries.omegaRuby: Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This Pokémon tends to leap into action before it thinks.
entries.alphaSapphire: Machamp is known as the Pokémon that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.
entries.sun: It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.
entries.moon: It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.
entries.ultraSun: It grasps its opponents with its four arms and twists them up in an intricate hold. People call it “the Machamp special.”
entries.ultraMoon: With four arms, it can attack and defend simultaneously. It's said to have mastered every martial art in the world.
entries.letsGoPikachu: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pokémon fires off awesome punches.
entries.letsGoEevee: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pokémon fires off awesome punches.
entries.sword: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
entries.shield: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
entries.shiningPearl: It can knock a train flying with a punch. However, it is terrible at delicate work using its fingers.
entries.legendsArceus: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokémon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.

entries.sword: The Gigantamax energy coursing through its arms makes its punches hit as hard as bomb blasts.
entries.shield: One of these Pokémon once used its immeasurable strength to lift a large ship that was in trouble. It then carried the ship to port.

entries.red: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.
entries.blue: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.
entries.yellow: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny insects with its vines and devours them.
entries.stadium: A kind of bug-eating plant that hunts small insects. It uses its roots as feet for walking.
entries.gold: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
entries.silver: It plants its feet deep underground to replenish water. It can't escape its enemy while it's rooted.
entries.crystal: If it notices anything that moves, it immediately flings its vine at the object.
entries.stadium2: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
entries.ruby: Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this POKéMON spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
entries.sapphire: Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this POKéMON spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
entries.emerald: A Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, it leaks a fluid that melts even iron.
entries.firered: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.
entries.leafgreen: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It appears to use its root feet to replenish moisture.
entries.diamond: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
entries.pearl: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
entries.platinum: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
entries.heartgold: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
entries.soulsilver: It plants its feet deep underground to replenish water. It can't escape its enemy while it's rooted.
entries.black: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
entries.white: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
entries.black2: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
entries.white2: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
entries.x: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
entries.y: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.
entries.omegaRuby: Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
entries.alphaSapphire: Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
entries.letsGoEevee: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
entries.shiningPearl: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

entries.red: It spits out PoisonPowder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.
entries.blue: It spits out PoisonPowder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.
entries.yellow: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is melted inside by strong acids.
entries.stadium: Armed with razor-sharp leaves, it uses toxic pollen to immobilize its enemy and melts the helpless foe with Acid.
entries.gold: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a neutralizing fluid.
entries.silver: If its prey is bigger than its mouth, it slices up the victim with sharp leaves, then eats every morsel.
entries.crystal: When its hungry, it swings its razor-sharp leaves, slicing up any unlucky object nearby for food.
entries.stadium2: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a neutralizing fluid.
entries.ruby: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
entries.sapphire: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
entries.emerald: At night, a Weepinbell hangs on to a tree branch with its hooked rear and sleeps. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
entries.firered: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
entries.leafgreen: It spits out poisonpowder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of acid.
entries.diamond: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.
entries.pearl: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.
entries.platinum: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.
entries.heartgold: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a protective fluid.
entries.soulsilver: If its prey is bigger than its mouth, it slices up the victim with sharp leaves, then eats every morsel.
