entries.brilliantDiamond: This Pokémon has the appearance of a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.
entries.shiningPearl: This Pokémon has the appearance of a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.

entries.red: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
entries.blue: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
entries.yellow: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is melted in a day, bones and all.
entries.stadium: Attracts prey with sweet-smelling honey. Its prey include bugs, naturally, and even large animals on occasion.
entries.gold: Acid that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.
entries.silver: This horrifying plant Pokémon attracts prey with aromatic honey, then melts them in its mouth.
entries.crystal: Once ingested into this Pokémon's body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.
entries.stadium2: Acid that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.
entries.ruby: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.
entries.sapphire: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.
entries.emerald: The long vine extending from its head is waved about as if it were a living thing to attract prey. When an unsuspecting victim approaches, it is swallowed whole.
entries.firered: Lures prey into its mouth with a honeylike aroma. The helpless prey is melted with a dissolving fluid.
entries.leafgreen: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
entries.diamond: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
entries.pearl: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
entries.platinum: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
entries.heartgold: Acid that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.
entries.soulsilver: This horrifying plant Pokémon attracts prey with aromatic honey, then melts them in its mouth.
entries.black: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
entries.white: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
entries.black2: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
entries.white2: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
entries.x: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
entries.y: Once ingested into this Pokémon's body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.
entries.omegaRuby: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.
entries.alphaSapphire: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
entries.letsGoEevee: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
entries.brilliantDiamond: In its mouth, it pools a fragrant nectar-like fluid. The fluid is really an acid that dissolves anything.
entries.shiningPearl: In its mouth, it pools a fragrant nectar-like fluid. The fluid is really an acid that dissolves anything.

entries.red: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.
entries.blue: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.
entries.yellow: It can sometimes be found all dry and shriveled up on a beach. Toss it back into the sea to revive it.
entries.stadium: Fires beams of light from its clear eyes. Floats around in shallow waters and may sting unwary anglers.
entries.gold: When the tide goes out, dehydrated Tentacool remains can be found washed up on the shore.
entries.silver: It drifts aimlessly in waves. Very difficult to see in water, it may not be noticed until it stings.
entries.crystal: As it floats along on the waves, it uses its toxic feelers to stab anything it touches.
entries.stadium2: When the tide goes out, dehydrated Tentacool remains can be found washed up on the shore.
entries.ruby: Tentacool's body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this Pokémon happens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.
entries.sapphire: Tentacool absorbs sunlight and refracts it using water inside its body to convert it into beam energy. This Pokémon shoots beams from its crystal-like eyes.
entries.emerald: Its body is almost entirely composed of water. It ensnares its foe with its two long tentacles, then stabs with the poison stingers at their tips.
entries.firered: Its eyes are as transparent as crystals. From them, it shoots mysterious beams of light.
entries.leafgreen: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.
entries.diamond: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
entries.pearl: It drifts in sea currents. Countless fishermen are hurt by its poison stingers.
entries.platinum: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.
entries.heartgold: When the tide goes out, dehydrated Tentacool remains can be found washed up on the shore.
entries.soulsilver: It drifts aimlessly in waves. Very difficult to see in water, it may not be noticed until it stings.
entries.black: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.
entries.white: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.
entries.black2: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.
entries.white2: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.
entries.x: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
entries.y: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.
entries.omegaRuby: Tentacool's body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this Pokémon happens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.
entries.alphaSapphire: Tentacool absorbs sunlight and refracts it using water inside its body to convert it into beam energy. This Pokémon shoots beams from the small round organ above its eyes.
entries.sun: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.
entries.moon: It drifts in shallow seas, such as the areas near beaches. If you get bitten or stabbed by its toxic tentacles, rush to the hospital.
entries.ultraSun: It drifts through the sea searching for prey. Its poisonous tentacles break off sometimes, but after a while, they grow back.
entries.ultraMoon: Its body is 99% water. The remaining 1% contains the organ that makes its poison.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It can sometimes be found all dry and shriveled up on a beach. Toss it back into the sea to revive it.
entries.letsGoEevee: It can sometimes be found all dry and shriveled up on a beach. Toss it back into the sea to revive it.
entries.sword: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.
entries.shield: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Its body is mostly composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
entries.shiningPearl: It drifts in sea currents. Countless fishers are hurt by its poison stingers.
entries.legendsArceus: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.

entries.red: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
entries.blue: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
entries.yellow: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.
entries.stadium: It has 80 tentacles. Once they wrap around an enemy, the tentacles will not release, no matter what.
entries.gold: Its 80 tentacles absorb water and stretch almost endlessly to constrict its prey and enemies.
entries.silver: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.
entries.crystal: When its 80 feelers absorb water, it stretches to become like a net to entangle its prey.
entries.stadium2: Its 80 tentacles absorb water and stretch almost endlessly to constrict its prey and enemies.
entries.ruby: Tentacruel has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow before lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast. This Pokémon's outburst causes rough waves around it.
entries.sapphire: Tentacruel has tentacles that can be freely elongated and shortened at will. It ensnares prey with its tentacles and weakens the prey by dosing it with a harsh toxin. It can catch up to 80 prey at the same time.
entries.emerald: It lives in complex rock formations on the ocean floor and traps prey using its 80 tentacles. Its red orbs glow when it grows excited or agitated.
entries.firered: It has 80 tentacles that move about freely. They can sting, causing poisoning and sharp, stabbing pain.
entries.leafgreen: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
entries.diamond: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison.
entries.pearl: It alerts others to danger by stridently flashing the red orbs on its head.
entries.platinum: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.
entries.heartgold: Its 80 tentacles absorb water and stretch almost endlessly to constrict its prey and enemies.
entries.soulsilver: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.
entries.black: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.
entries.white: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.
entries.black2: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.
entries.white2: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.
entries.x: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
entries.y: It has 80 tentacles that move about freely. They can sting, causing poisoning and sharp, stabbing pain.
entries.omegaRuby: Tentacruel has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow before lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast. This Pokémon's outburst creates rough waves around it.
entries.alphaSapphire: Tentacruel has tentacles that can be freely elongated and shortened at will. It ensnares prey with its tentacles and weakens the prey by dosing it with a harsh toxin. It can catch up to 80 prey at the same time.
entries.sun: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.
entries.moon: Although these Pokémon are rare, when a large outbreak of them occurs, all fish Pokémon disappear from the surrounding sea.
entries.ultraSun: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.
entries.ultraMoon: It communicates with others of its kind by lighting up the red orbs on its head. When the orbs are blinking, it's a warning sign.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.
entries.letsGoEevee: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.
entries.sword: When the red orbs on Tentacruel's head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.
entries.shield: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.
entries.brilliantDiamond: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison.
entries.shiningPearl: It alerts others to danger by stridently flashing the red orbs on its head.
entries.legendsArceus: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.

entries.red: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
entries.blue: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
entries.yellow: Commonly found near mountain trails, etc. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.
entries.stadium: When traveling uphill, if it encounters a raised step, it cleverly hoists itself up and over using its two arms.
entries.gold: Most people may not notice, but a closer look should reveal that there are many Geodude around.
entries.silver: It uses its arms to steadily climb steep mountain paths. It swings its fists around if angered.
entries.crystal: Proud of their sturdy bodies, they bash against each other in a contest to prove whose is harder.
entries.stadium2: Most people may not notice, but a closer look should reveal that there are many Geodude around.
entries.ruby: The longer a Geodude lives, the more its edges are chipped and worn away, making it more rounded in appearance. However, this Pokémon's heart will remain hard, craggy, and rough always.
entries.sapphire: When Geodude sleeps deeply, it buries itself halfway into the ground. It will not awaken even if hikers step on it unwittingly. In the morning, this Pokémon rolls downhill in search of food.
entries.emerald: It climbs mountain paths using only the power of its arms. Because they look just like boulders lining paths, hikers may step on them without noticing.
entries.firered: Its round form makes it easy to pick up. Some people have used them to hurl at each other in a snowball fight.
entries.leafgreen: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
entries.diamond: Many live on mountain trails and remain half buried while keeping an eye on climbers.
entries.pearl: It is impossible to distinguish from rocks. It slams against others in contests of hardness.
entries.platinum: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
entries.heartgold: Most people may not notice, but a closer look should reveal that there are many Geodude around.
entries.soulsilver: It uses its arms to steadily climb steep mountain paths. It swings its fists around if angered.
entries.black: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
entries.white: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
entries.black2: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
entries.white2: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
entries.x: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
entries.y: It is impossible to distinguish from rocks. It slams against others in contests of hardness.
entries.omegaRuby: The longer a Geodude lives, the more its edges are chipped and worn away, making it more rounded in appearance. However, this Pokémon's heart will remain hard, craggy, and rough always.
entries.alphaSapphire: When Geodude sleeps deeply, it buries itself halfway into the ground. It will not awaken even if hikers step on it unwittingly. In the morning, this Pokémon rolls downhill in search of food.
entries.sun: Its round body makes it easy to pick up, but it is hard and heavy. It's dangerous to play with them as if they were snowballs.
entries.moon: There are plenty of them to be found along any road. A scholar with too much free time once counted a hundred of them along a single route.
entries.ultraSun: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.
entries.ultraMoon: It uses both hands to climb precipitous cliffs. People who see it in action have been known to take up bouldering.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.
entries.letsGoEevee: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Many live on mountain trails and remain half-buried while keeping an eye on climbers.
entries.shiningPearl: It is impossible to distinguish from rocks. It slams against others in contests of toughness.
entries.legendsArceus: Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb along harsh mountain roads. Can be troublesome—carelessly kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.

entries.sun: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.
entries.moon: If you accidentally step on a Geodude sleeping on the ground, you'll hear a crunching sound and feel a shock ripple through your entire body.
entries.ultraSun: If you mistake it for a rock and step on it, it will headbutt you in anger. In addition to the pain, it will also zap you with a shock.
entries.ultraMoon: Geodude compete against each other with headbutts. The iron sand on their heads will stick to whichever one has stronger magnetism.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Its stone head is imbued with electricity and magnetism. If you carelessly step on one, you'll be in for a painful shock.
entries.letsGoEevee: Its stone head is imbued with electricity and magnetism. If you carelessly step on one, you'll be in for a painful shock.

entries.red: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
entries.blue: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
entries.yellow: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.
entries.stadium: Rolls on steep mountainous trails. It plows through grass, trees and anything else that gets in its way.
entries.gold: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
entries.silver: A slow walker, it rolls to move. It pays no attention to any object that happens to be in its path.
entries.crystal: It travels by rolling on mountain paths. If it gains too much speed, it stops by running into huge rocks.
entries.stadium2: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
entries.ruby: Graveler grows by feeding on rocks. Apparently, it prefers to eat rocks that are covered in moss. This Pokémon eats it way through a ton of rocks on a daily basis.
entries.sapphire: Rocks are Graveler's favorite food. This Pokémon will climb a mountain from the base to the summit, crunchingly feasting on rocks all the while. Upon reaching the peak, it rolls back down to the bottom.
entries.emerald: They descend from mountains by tumbling down steep slopes. They are so brutal, they smash aside obstructing trees and massive boulders with thunderous tackles.
entries.firered: Be careful while hiking on mountain trails. Graveler may come rolling down the path without slowing.
entries.leafgreen: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
entries.diamond: Graveler make their homes on sheer cliff faces by gouging out numerous horizontal holes.
entries.pearl: It tumbles down slopes, heedless of any body parts chipping off. It eats a ton of rocks daily.
entries.platinum: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.
entries.heartgold: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
entries.soulsilver: A slow walker, it rolls to move. It pays no attention to any object that happens to be in its path.
entries.black: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.
entries.white: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.
entries.black2: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.
entries.white2: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.
entries.x: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
entries.y: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
entries.omegaRuby: Graveler grows by feeding on rocks. Apparently, it prefers to eat rocks that are covered in moss. This Pokémon eats its way through a ton of rocks on a daily basis.
entries.alphaSapphire: Rocks are Graveler's favorite food. This Pokémon will climb a mountain from the base to the summit, crunchingly feasting on rocks all the while. Upon reaching the peak, it rolls back down to the bottom.
entries.sun: Mossy rocks are its favorite food. It can devour a ton a day while crunching loudly.
entries.moon: This slow-footed Pokémon moves by curling up and rolling instead of walking. With enough momentum, its speed can exceed 60 mph.
entries.ultraSun: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit, it rolls back down the way it came.
entries.ultraMoon: It travels by rolling down cliffs. If it falls into a river, it will explode with its last gasp.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.
entries.letsGoEevee: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Graveler make their homes on sheer cliff faces that have numerous holes in them.
entries.shiningPearl: It tumbles down slopes, heedless of any body parts chipping off. It eats a ton of rocks daily.
entries.legendsArceus: Dwells in holes dug into sheer walls of stone. It enjoys rolling down slopes as though it were a boulder during a rockfall, so keep an eye upward while traversing mountain roads.

entries.sun: Its preferred food is dravite. After it has eaten this mineral, crystals form inside the Pokémon, rising to the surface of part of its body.
entries.moon: They eat rocks and often get into a scrap over them. The shock of Graveler smashing together causes a flash of light and a booming noise.
entries.ultraSun: When two Graveler fight each other, it fills the surroundings with flashes of light and sound. People call it the “fireworks of the earth.”
entries.ultraMoon: Graveler's entire body is tinged with electricity due to the stones it likes to eat. It's very quick-tempered.
entries.letsGoPikachu: When it comes rolling down a mountain path, anything in its way gets zapped by electricity and sent flying.
entries.letsGoEevee: When it comes rolling down a mountain path, anything in its way gets zapped by electricity and sent flying.

entries.red: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.
entries.blue: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.
entries.yellow: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it's exposed to air.
entries.stadium: Its body, which weighs over 660 pounds, is as hard as stone. It grows bigger by shedding its skin once a year.
entries.gold: It sheds its skin once a year. The discarded shell immediately hardens and crumbles away.
entries.silver: It is capable of blowing itself up. It uses this explosive force to jump from mountain to mountain.
entries.crystal: Its rock-like body is so durable, even high-powered dynamite blasts fail to scratch its rugged hide.
entries.stadium2: It sheds its skin once a year. the discarded shell immediately hardens and crumbles away.
entries.ruby: Golem live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake, these Pokémon will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.
entries.sapphire: Golem is known for rolling down from mountains. To prevent them from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves have been dug into the sides of mountains to serve as guideways for diverting this Pokémon's course.
entries.emerald: It is said to live in volcanic craters on mountain peaks. Once a year, it sheds its hide and grows larger. The shed hide crumbles and returns to the soil.
entries.firered: It is enclosed in a hard shell that is as rugged as slabs of rock. It sheds skin once a year to grow larger.
entries.leafgreen: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without taking damage.
entries.diamond: It sheds its hide once a year. Its boulderlike body is so tough, even dynamite can't harm it.
entries.pearl: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
entries.platinum: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulderlike body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
entries.heartgold: It sheds its skin once a year. The discarded shell immediately hardens and crumbles away.
entries.soulsilver: It is capable of blowing itself up. It uses this explosive force to jump from mountain to mountain.
entries.black: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulderlike body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
entries.white: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
entries.black2: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
entries.white2: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
entries.x: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
entries.y: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
entries.omegaRuby: Golem live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake, these Pokémon will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.
entries.alphaSapphire: Golem is known for rolling down from mountains. To prevent them from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves have been dug into the sides of mountains to serve as guideways for diverting this Pokémon's course.
entries.sun: Its body can survive dynamite blasts without a single scratch, but it hates rain and humidity.
entries.moon: Once a year, this Pokémon molts, and its shed shell returns to the soil. This process creates enriched soil, so farmers collect the shells.
entries.ultraSun: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.
entries.ultraMoon: It detonates its own body. The power from that explosion can propel it up steep mountain paths with amazing speed.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it's exposed to air.
entries.letsGoEevee: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it's exposed to air.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It sheds its hide once a year. Its boulder-like body is so tough, even dynamite can't harm it.
entries.shiningPearl: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
entries.legendsArceus: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.

entries.sun: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn't fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.
entries.moon: Because it can't fire boulders at a rapid pace, it's been known to seize nearby Geodude and fire them from its back.
entries.ultraSun: It's grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.
entries.ultraMoon: It shoots large rocks that are charged with electricity. Tremendous electric shocks are flung out across the whole area of impact.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It uses magnetism to accelerate and fire off rocks tinged with electricity. Even if it doesn't score a direct hit, the jolt of electricity will do the job.
entries.letsGoEevee: It uses magnetism to accelerate and fire off rocks tinged with electricity. Even if it doesn't score a direct hit, the jolt of electricity will do the job.

entries.red: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.
entries.blue: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.
entries.yellow: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
entries.stadium: Capable of jumping over the Eiffel Tower in a single giant leap. Its hooves are ten times harder than diamonds.
entries.gold: It is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.
entries.silver: Its hind legs, which have harder-than-diamond hooves, kick back at any presence it senses behind it.
entries.crystal: Training by jumping over grass that grows longer every day has made it a world-class jumper.
entries.stadium2: It is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.
entries.ruby: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
entries.sapphire: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
entries.emerald: A Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. Its legs become stronger as it stumbles and falls while trying to keep up with its parent.
entries.firered: Its body is light, and its legs are incredibly powerful. It can clear Ayers Rock in one leap.
entries.leafgreen: Its hooves are ten times harder than diamond. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.
entries.diamond: About an hour after birth, its fiery mane and tail grow out, giving it an impressive appearance.
entries.pearl: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.
entries.platinum: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
entries.heartgold: It is a weak runner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.
entries.soulsilver: Its hind legs, which have hooves that are harder than diamond, kick back at any presence it senses behind it.
entries.black: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
entries.white: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
entries.black2: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
entries.white2: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
entries.x: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
entries.y: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.
entries.omegaRuby: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
entries.alphaSapphire: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
entries.letsGoEevee: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
entries.sword: It can't run properly when it's newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.
entries.shield: If you've been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.
entries.brilliantDiamond: About an hour after birth, Ponyta's fiery mane and tail grow out, giving the Pokémon an impressive appearance.
entries.shiningPearl: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parents. It runs all day in fields and on mountains.
entries.legendsArceus: These Pokémon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.

entries.sword: Its small horn hides a healing power. With a few rubs from this Pokémon's horn, any slight wound you have will be healed.
entries.shield: This Pokémon will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.

entries.red: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
entries.blue: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
entries.yellow: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.
entries.stadium: Unable to restrain itself from running after fast trains or cars. Capable of reaching 150 mph at full speed.
entries.gold: At full gallop, its four hooves barely touch the ground because it moves so incredibly fast.
entries.silver: With incredible acceleration, it reaches its top speed of 150 mph after running just ten steps.
entries.crystal: It just loves to gallop. The faster it goes, the longer the swaying flames of its mane will become.
entries.stadium2: At full gallop, its four hooves barely touch the ground because it moves so incredibly fast.
entries.ruby: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
entries.sapphire: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
entries.emerald: It usually canters casually in the fields and plains. But once a Rapidash turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
entries.firered: It can gallop at a top speed of 150 miles per hour. It can race as fast as a bullet train while ablaze.
entries.leafgreen: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
entries.diamond: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.
entries.pearl: It has astounding acceleration. From a standstill, it can reach top speed within 10 steps.
entries.platinum: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.
entries.heartgold: At full gallop, its four hooves barely touch the ground because it moves so incredibly fast.
entries.soulsilver: With incredible acceleration, it reaches its top speed of 150 mph after running just 10 steps.
entries.black: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.
entries.white: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.
entries.black2: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.
entries.white2: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.
entries.x: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
entries.y: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.
entries.omegaRuby: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
entries.alphaSapphire: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.
entries.letsGoEevee: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.
entries.sword: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.
entries.shield: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd's pace and direction of travel.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.
entries.shiningPearl: It has astounding acceleration. From a standstill, it can reach top speed within 10 steps.
entries.legendsArceus: Fiery mane aglow, Rapidash darts like an arrow across the land. This prodigiously swift creature can traverse the vast region of Hisui in a day and a half.

entries.sword: Little can stand up to its psycho cut. Unleashed from this Pokémon's horn, the move will punch a hole right through a thick metal sheet.
entries.shield: Brave and prideful, this Pokémon dashes airily through the forest, its steps aided by the psychic power stored in the fur on its fetlocks.

entries.red: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
entries.blue: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
entries.yellow: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.
entries.stadium: A dopey Pokémon that remains in a daze except when fishing with its tail. Awake or asleep, there is little difference.
entries.gold: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
entries.silver: A sweet sap leaks from its tail's tip. Although not nutritious, the tail is pleasant to chew on.
entries.crystal: It is always so absent-minded that it won't react, even if its flavorful tail is bitten.
entries.stadium2: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
entries.ruby: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
entries.sapphire: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
entries.emerald: It catches prey by dipping its tail in water at the side of a river. But it often forgets what it is doing and spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
entries.firered: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
entries.leafgreen: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
entries.diamond: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
entries.pearl: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
entries.platinum: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
entries.heartgold: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
entries.soulsilver: A sweet sap leaks from its tail's tip. Although not nutritious, the tail is pleasant to chew on.
entries.black: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
entries.white: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
entries.black2: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
entries.white2: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
entries.x: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
entries.y: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
entries.omegaRuby: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
entries.alphaSapphire: Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
entries.sun: Its long tail often breaks off. It doesn't really feel any pain, though, and the tail grows back, so Slowpoke isn't particularly bothered.
entries.moon: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.
entries.ultraSun: There are some places where Slowpoke is worshiped because of a long-standing belief that whenever Slowpoke yawns, it rains.
entries.ultraMoon: Although their tails, which fall off naturally, can easily be found lying around, they're a precious ingredient for cooking.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.
entries.letsGoEevee: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.
entries.sword: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won't feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won't notice when its tail grows back, either.
entries.shield: When this Pokémon's tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
entries.shiningPearl: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.

entries.sword: Although this Pokémon is normally zoned out, its expression abruptly sharpens on occasion. The cause for this seems to lie in Slowpoke's diet.
entries.shield: Because Galarian Slowpoke eat the seeds of a plant that grows only in Galar, their tails have developed a spicy flavor.

entries.red: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.
entries.blue: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.
entries.yellow: Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.
entries.stadium: If its tail is bitten by a Shellder, Slowpoke evolves into Slowbro. The Shellder seems to like its crunchy tail.
entries.gold: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.
entries.silver: Naturally dull to begin with, it lost its ability to feel pain due to Shellder's seeping poison.
entries.crystal: An attached Shellder won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
entries.stadium2: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.
entries.ruby: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
entries.sapphire: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
entries.emerald: Its tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This forces it to reluctantly swim and catch prey.
entries.firered: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
entries.leafgreen: The Shellder that latches onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's leftover scraps.
entries.diamond: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.pearl: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.platinum: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.heartgold: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.
entries.soulsilver: Naturally dull to begin with, it lost its ability to feel pain due to Shellder's seeping poison.
entries.black: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.white: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.black2: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.white2: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.x: An attached Shellder won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
entries.y: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
entries.omegaRuby: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
entries.alphaSapphire: Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
entries.sun: It spaces out while gazing at the sea. With Shellder's poison flowing through its body, it becomes even spacier.
entries.moon: Whenever Shellder bites down hard on its tail, it gives Slowbro a flash of inspiration...which it forgets a moment later.
entries.ultraSun: Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back into Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder, breaks off.
entries.ultraMoon: Shellder, in its greed to suck out more and more sweetness from Slowbro's tail, has metamorphosed into a spiral-shaped shell.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.
entries.letsGoEevee: Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.
entries.sword: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.
entries.shield: Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Though usually dim-witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.shiningPearl: Though usually dim-witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.

entries.sun: All the energy from Mega Evolution poured into the Shellder on its tail, leaving Slowpoke to be swallowed whole.
entries.moon: When bathed in the energy of Mega Evolution, Shellder converts into impregnable armor. There is virtually no change in Slowpoke.
entries.ultraSun: Tremendous energy strengthened the power of the Shellder on its tail, but it doesn't really affect Slowpoke.
entries.ultraMoon: Having been swallowed whole by Shellder, Slowbro now has an iron defense. It's pretty comfortable in there, too.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Under the influence of Shellder's digestive fluids, Slowpoke has awakened, gaining a great deal of power–and a little motivation to boot.
entries.letsGoEevee: Under the influence of Shellder's digestive fluids, Slowpoke has awakened, gaining a great deal of power–and a little motivation to boot.

entries.sword: A Shellder bite set off a chemical reaction with the spices inside Slowbro's body, causing Slowbro to become a Poison-type Pokémon.
entries.shield: If this Pokémon squeezes the tongue of the Shellder biting it, the Shellder will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell.

entries.red: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.
entries.blue: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.
entries.yellow: It is born with the ability to defy gravity. It floats in air on powerful electromagnetic waves.
entries.stadium: Appears as if out of nowhere. It floats using anti-gravity and discharges electricity from two side-mounted units.
entries.gold: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach trainers if they are using their Pokégear.
entries.silver: The units at the sides of its body generate anti-gravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
entries.crystal: The electricity emitted by the units on each side of its body cause it to become a strong magnet.
entries.stadium2: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach trainers if they are using their Pokégear.
entries.ruby: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this Pokémon clinging to the breaker box.
entries.sapphire: Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This Pokémon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.
entries.emerald: The units at its sides are extremely powerful magnets. They generate enough magnetism to draw in iron objects from over 300 feet away.
entries.firered: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.
entries.leafgreen: Uses antigravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.
entries.diamond: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
entries.pearl: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
entries.platinum: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
entries.heartgold: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach trainers if they are using their Pokégear.
entries.soulsilver: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
entries.black: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
entries.white: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
entries.black2: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
entries.white2: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
entries.x: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
entries.y: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.
entries.omegaRuby: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this Pokémon clinging to the breaker box.
entries.alphaSapphire: Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This Pokémon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.
entries.sun: They gather in places where electricity is available. They can be found clinging to the steel towers used to support power lines.
entries.moon: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.
entries.ultraSun: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.
entries.ultraMoon: Perhaps because electrical lines are often buried these days, the number of Magnemite attacks on power plants has increased.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity. It floats while emitting powerful electromagnetic waves.
entries.letsGoEevee: It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity. It floats while emitting powerful electromagnetic waves.
entries.sword: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it'll start moving again.
entries.shield: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.
entries.brilliantDiamond: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
entries.shiningPearl: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
entries.legendsArceus: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.

entries.red: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
entries.blue: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
entries.yellow: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6F degrees within 3,300 feet.
entries.stadium: Formed by Magnemite that link together when the number of black spots on the sun increases. Fires high-voltage power, etc.
entries.gold: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
entries.silver: The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinities.
entries.crystal: When many Magneton gather together, the resulting magnetic storm disrupts radio waves.
entries.stadium2: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
entries.ruby: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.
entries.sapphire: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon inside a Poké Ball.
entries.emerald: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. It generates powerful radio waves that raise temperatures by 3.6 degrees F within a 3,300-foot radius.
entries.firered: A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.
entries.leafgreen: Formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
entries.diamond: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.
entries.pearl: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.
entries.platinum: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
entries.heartgold: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
entries.soulsilver: The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinity.
entries.black: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
entries.white: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
entries.black2: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.
entries.white2: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.
entries.x: A link cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.
entries.y: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.
entries.omegaRuby: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.
entries.alphaSapphire: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon inside a Poké Ball.
entries.sun: When three Magnemite link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.
entries.moon: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
entries.ultraSun: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.
entries.ultraMoon: When rain clouds form, many Magneton gather in high places to wait for lightning to strike.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.
entries.letsGoEevee: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.
entries.sword: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.
entries.shield: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.
entries.brilliantDiamond: A Magneton is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group of these Pokémon can set off a magnetic storm.
entries.shiningPearl: A Magneton is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group of these Pokémon can set off a magnetic storm.
entries.legendsArceus: Three Magnemite gathered to evolve into this Pokémon. The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful magnetism destroys my research equipment.

entries.red: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.
entries.blue: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.
entries.yellow: Lives where reedy plants grow. They are rarely seen, so it's thought their numbers are decreasing.
entries.stadium: Always carries the stalk of an unidentified plant. The stalk is said to be used for making a nest or as a weapon.
entries.gold: If anyone tries to disturb where the essential plant sticks grow, it uses its own stick to thwart them.
entries.silver: If it eats the plant stick it carries as emergency rations, it runs off in search of a new stick.
entries.crystal: In order to prevent their extinction, more people have made an effort to breed these Pokémon.
entries.stadium2: If anyone tries to disturb where the essential plant sticks grow, it uses its own stick to thwart them.
entries.ruby: Farfetch'd is always seen with a stick from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good sticks and bad sticks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over sticks.
entries.sapphire: Farfetch'd is always seen with a stick from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good sticks and bad sticks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over sticks.
entries.emerald: It is always seen with a stick from a plant. Apparently, there are good sticks and bad sticks. This Pokémon occasionally fights with others over choice sticks.
entries.firered: It always walks about with a plant stalk clamped in its beak. The stalk is used for building its nest.
entries.leafgreen: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.
entries.diamond: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.pearl: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.platinum: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.heartgold: If anyone tries to disturb where the essential plant sticks grow, it uses its own stick to thwart them.
entries.soulsilver: If it eats the plant stalk it carries as emergency rations, it runs off in search of a new stalk.
entries.black: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.white: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.black2: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.white2: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.x: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.
entries.y: It always walks about with a plant stalk clamped in its beak. The stalk is used for building its nest.
entries.omegaRuby: Farfetch'd is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
entries.alphaSapphire: Farfetch'd is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
entries.letsGoPikachu: They live where reedy plants grow. Farfetch'd are rarely seen, so it's thought their numbers are decreasing.
entries.letsGoEevee: They live where reedy plants grow. Farfetch'd are rarely seen, so it's thought their numbers are decreasing.
entries.sword: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
entries.shield: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.shiningPearl: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

entries.sword: The Farfetch'd of the Galar region are brave warriors, and they wield thick, tough leeks in battle.
entries.shield: The stalks of leeks are thicker and longer in the Galar region. Farfetch'd that adapted to these stalks took on a unique form.

entries.red: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
entries.blue: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
entries.yellow: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
entries.stadium: A Pokémon with two heads. More skilled at running than flying, it is capable of racing at speeds over 60 mph.
entries.gold: By alternately raising and lowering its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.
entries.silver: It races through grassy plains with powerful strides, leaving footprints up to four inches deep.
entries.crystal: It lives on a grassy plain where it can see a long way. If it sees an enemy, it runs away at 60 mph.
entries.stadium2: By alternately raising and lowering its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.
entries.ruby: Doduo's two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
entries.sapphire: Doduo's two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.
entries.emerald: Even while eating or sleeping, one of the heads remains always vigilant for any sign of danger. When threatened, it flees at over 60 miles per hour.
entries.firered: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.
entries.leafgreen: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
entries.diamond: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with telepathic power.
entries.pearl: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with telepathic power.
entries.platinum: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with telepathic power.
entries.heartgold: By alternately raising and lowering its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.
entries.soulsilver: It races through grassy plains with powerful strides, leaving footprints up to four inches deep.
entries.black: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
entries.white: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
entries.black2: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
entries.white2: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
entries.x: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.
entries.y: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
