entries.alphaSapphire: Doduo's two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
entries.letsGoEevee: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
entries.brilliantDiamond: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
entries.shiningPearl: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

entries.red: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.
entries.blue: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.
entries.yellow: One of Doduo's 2 heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 MPH in prairies.
entries.stadium: The three heads express joy, sorrow and anger as they plan strategy together. When it sleeps, one head remains awake.
entries.gold: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and become immobilized.
entries.silver: If one of the heads gets to eat, the others will be satisfied, too, and they will stop squabbling.
entries.crystal: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads—even for a second—will get pecked severely.
entries.stadium2: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and become immobilized.
entries.ruby: Watch out if Dodrio's three heads are looking in three separate directions. It's a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don't go near this Pokémon if it's being wary - it may decide to peck you.
entries.sapphire: Apparently, the heads aren't the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
entries.emerald: A peculiar Pokémon species with three heads. It vigorously races across grassy plains even in arid seasons with little rainfall.
entries.firered: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.
entries.leafgreen: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head is said to stay awake.
entries.diamond: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.pearl: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.platinum: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.heartgold: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and fall into a state of immobility.
entries.soulsilver: If one of the heads gets to eat, the others will be satisfied, too, and they will stop squabbling.
entries.black: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.white: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.black2: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.white2: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.x: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads—even for a second—will get pecked severely.
entries.y: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.
entries.omegaRuby: Watch out if Dodrio's three heads are looking in three separate directions. It's a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don't go near this Pokémon if it's being wary-it may decide to peck you.
entries.alphaSapphire: Apparently, the heads aren't the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
entries.letsGoPikachu: One of Doduo's two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
entries.letsGoEevee: One of Doduo's two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
entries.brilliantDiamond: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. This Pokémon runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.shiningPearl: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. This Pokémon runs at nearly 40 mph.

entries.red: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
entries.blue: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
entries.yellow: Loves freezing cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14F degrees.
entries.stadium: It boasts a thick hide covered with light blue fur. It plows through ice floes even in water 40 degrees below 0.
entries.gold: Although it can't walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas.
entries.silver: In daytime, it is often found asleep, on the seabed in shallow waters. Its nostrils close while it swims.
entries.crystal: The light blue fur that covers it keeps it protected against the cold. It loves iceberg filled oceans.
entries.stadium2: Although it can't walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas.
entries.ruby: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
entries.sapphire: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
entries.emerald: Seel hunt for prey in frigid, ice-covered seas. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
entries.firered: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.leafgreen: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick icebergs.
entries.diamond: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
entries.pearl: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
entries.platinum: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
entries.heartgold: Although it can't walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas.
entries.soulsilver: In daytime, it is often found asleep on the seabed in shallow waters. Its nostrils close while it swims.
entries.black: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
entries.white: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
entries.black2: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.
entries.white2: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.
entries.x: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
entries.y: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.omegaRuby: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
entries.alphaSapphire: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
entries.ultraSun: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.
entries.ultraMoon: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don't bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.letsGoEevee: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.brilliantDiamond: This Pokémon lives on icebergs. It uses the sharp point on its head to break up ice as it swims in the sea.
entries.shiningPearl: This Pokémon lives on icebergs. It uses the sharp point on its head to break up ice as it swims in the sea.

entries.red: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.
entries.blue: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.
entries.yellow: Its entire body is a snowy-white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
entries.stadium: It stores thermal energy inside its pure white, fur-covered body. It swims in frigid water at eight knots.
entries.gold: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
entries.silver: It loves frigid seas with ice floes. It uses its long tail to change swimming direction quickly.
entries.crystal: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when it's cold.
entries.stadium2: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
entries.ruby: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.sapphire: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.emerald: It loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.firered: Its body is covered with a pure white fur. The colder the weather, the more active it becomes.
entries.leafgreen: It stores thermal energy in the body. It swims at a steady eight knots even in intensely cold waters.
entries.diamond: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
entries.pearl: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
entries.platinum: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
entries.heartgold: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
entries.soulsilver: It loves frigid seas with ice floes. It uses its long tail to change swimming direction quickly.
entries.black: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
entries.white: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
entries.black2: Its streamlined body has low resistance, and it swims around cold oceans at a speed of eight knots.
entries.white2: Its streamlined body has low resistance, and it swims around cold oceans at a speed of eight knots.
entries.x: Its body is covered with a pure white fur. The colder the weather, the more active it becomes.
entries.y: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
entries.omegaRuby: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.alphaSapphire: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.ultraSun: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It's especially fond of Wishiwashi.
entries.ultraMoon: It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise in its body temperature helps its digestion.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
entries.letsGoEevee: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
entries.brilliantDiamond: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
entries.shiningPearl: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.

entries.red: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
entries.blue: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
entries.yellow: Made of hardened sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won't grow in its path.
entries.stadium: Sludge that was transformed when exposed to X-rays from the moon. Loves sludge, industrial waste and other refuse.
entries.gold: As it moves, it loses bits of its body from which new Grimer emerge. This worsens the stench around it.
entries.silver: Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again.
entries.crystal: When two of these Pokémon's bodies are combined together, new poisons are created.
entries.stadium2: As it moves, it loses bits of its body from which new Grimer emerge. This worsens the stench around it.
entries.ruby: Grimer's sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This Pokémon enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.
entries.sapphire: Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted seabed. This Pokémon loves anything filthy. It constantly leaks a horribly germ- infested fluid from all over its body.
entries.emerald: Born from polluted sludge in the sea, Grimer's favorite food is anything filthy. They feed on wastewater pumped out from factories.
entries.firered: Sludge exposed to X rays from the moon transformed into Grimer. It loves feeding on filthy things.
entries.leafgreen: Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
entries.diamond: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
entries.pearl: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
entries.platinum: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
entries.heartgold: As it moves, it loses bits of its body from which new Grimer emerge. This worsens the stench around it.
entries.soulsilver: Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again.
entries.black: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
entries.white: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
entries.black2: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.
entries.white2: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.
entries.x: Sludge exposed to X-rays from the moon transformed into Grimer. It loves feeding on filthy things.
entries.y: Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
entries.omegaRuby: Grimer's sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This Pokémon enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.
entries.alphaSapphire: Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted seabed. This Pokémon loves anything filthy. It constantly leaks a horribly germ- infested fluid from all over its body.
entries.sun: Its main source of food is the slimy industrial waste of factories. This Pokémon's numbers have been decreasing in recent years.
entries.moon: It was born from sludge transformed by exposure to X-rays from the moon. When its internal load of germs decreases, it dies.
entries.ultraSun: It was born from sludge on the ocean floor. In a sterile environment, the germs within its body can't multiply, and it dies.
entries.ultraMoon: The wastewater coming from factories is clean these days, so Grimer have nothing to eat. They're said to be on the verge of extinction.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won't grow in its path.
entries.letsGoEevee: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won't grow in its path.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
entries.shiningPearl: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.

entries.sun: A Grimer, which had been brought in to solve a problem with garbage, developed over time into this form.
entries.moon: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.
entries.ultraSun: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.
entries.ultraMoon: Brought to Alola to solve the garbage problem, Grimer seems to relish any and all kinds of trash.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It has a passion for trash above all else, speedily digesting it and creating brilliant crystals of sparkling poison.
entries.letsGoEevee: It has a passion for trash above all else, speedily digesting it and creating brilliant crystals of sparkling poison.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.
entries.shiningPearl: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.

entries.red: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
entries.blue: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
entries.yellow: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration, it lost its sense of smell.
entries.stadium: Becomes indistinguishable if it hides in dirt. Touching its sludge-covered body causes horrible poisonings.
entries.gold: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around them worse.
entries.silver: Its body is made of a powerful poison. Touching it accidentally will cause a fever that requires bed rest.
entries.crystal: As it moves, a very strong poison leaks from it, making the ground there barren for three years.
entries.stadium2: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around them worse.
entries.ruby: From Muk's body seeps a foul fluid that gives off a nose-bendingly horrible stench. Just one drop of this Pokémon's body fluid can turn a pool stagnant and rancid.
entries.sapphire: This Pokémon's favorite food is anything that is repugnantly filthy. In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing away litter on the streets, Muk are certain to gather.
entries.emerald: It prefers warm and humid habitats. In the summertime, the toxic substances in its body intensify, making Muk reek like putrid kitchen garbage.
entries.firered: It is usually undetectable because it blends in with the ground. Touching it can cause terrible poisoning.
entries.leafgreen: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
entries.diamond: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
entries.pearl: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
entries.platinum: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
entries.heartgold: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around them worse.
entries.soulsilver: Its body is made of a powerful poison. Touching it accidentally will cause a fever that requires bed rest.
entries.black: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
entries.white: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
entries.black2: It's so stinky! Muk's body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.
entries.white2: It's so stinky! Muk's body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.
entries.x: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around them worse.
entries.y: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
entries.omegaRuby: From Muk's body seeps a foul fluid that gives off a nose-bendingly horrible stench. Just one drop of this Pokémon's body fluid can turn a pool stagnant and rancid.
entries.alphaSapphire: This Pokémon's favorite food is anything that is repugnantly filthy. In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing away litter on the streets, Muk are certain to gather.
entries.sun: The stench it gives off will make your nose scrunch up. Still, there are Muk fans who think that's a good thing.
entries.moon: After recent environmental improvements, this Pokémon is now hardly seen at all. People speculate that it may go extinct at some point.
entries.ultraSun: Their food sources have decreased, and their numbers have declined sharply. Sludge ponds are being built to prevent their extinction.
entries.ultraMoon: Because they scatter germs everywhere, they've long been targeted for extermination, leading to a steep decline in their population.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.
entries.letsGoEevee: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.
entries.brilliantDiamond: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid kills plants and trees immediately upon contact.
entries.shiningPearl: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid kills plants and trees immediately upon contact.

entries.sun: The garbage it eats causes continuous chemical changes in its body, which produce its exceedingly vivid coloration.
entries.moon: While it's unexpectedly quiet and friendly, if it's not fed any trash for a while, it will smash its Trainer's furnishings and eat up the fragments.
entries.ultraSun: There are over a hundred kinds of poison inside its body. Chemical reactions between different poisons are the source of its vitality.
entries.ultraMoon: What look like fangs and claws are actually crystallized poison that will afflict you at a mere touch, so don't get too close.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Muk's coloration becomes increasingly vivid the more it feasts on its favorite dish–trash.
entries.letsGoEevee: Muk's coloration becomes increasingly vivid the more it feasts on its favorite dish–trash.

entries.red: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
entries.blue: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
entries.yellow: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
entries.stadium: Its shell is harder than diamond. It hides in sand on the sea floor and catches prey with its soft tongue.
entries.gold: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
entries.silver: Grains of sand trapped in its shells mix with its body fluids to form beautiful pearls.
entries.crystal: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
entries.stadium2: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
entries.ruby: At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
entries.sapphire: At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
entries.emerald: At night, it burrows a hole in the seafloor with its broad tongue to make a place to sleep. While asleep, it closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
entries.firered: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
entries.leafgreen: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
entries.diamond: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entries.pearl: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entries.platinum: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entries.heartgold: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
entries.soulsilver: Grains of sand trapped in its shells mix with its body fluids to form beautiful pearls.
entries.black: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entries.white: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entries.black2: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entries.white2: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.

entries.y: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.

entries.sun: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.
entries.moon: This Pokémon's tongue is always hanging out. It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up sand from the seabed in its search for food.
entries.ultraSun: The sand that accumulates inside its shell eventually becomes a pearl. But the pearl gets in the way, so it spits it out and discards it.
entries.ultraMoon: Even when its shell is closed, its tongue still hangs out. If you give its tongue a good yank, the shock will cause Shellder to open its shell.
entries.letsGoPikachu: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
entries.letsGoEevee: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
entries.sword: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
entries.shield: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entries.shiningPearl: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.

entries.red: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
entries.blue: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
entries.yellow: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamonds shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
entries.stadium: Its shell is so hard, it can even withstand a bomb. No one has ever seen what is inside its shell.
entries.gold: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
entries.silver: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
entries.crystal: Even a missile can't break the spikes it uses to stab opponents. They're even harder than its shell.
entries.stadium2: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
entries.ruby: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
entries.sapphire: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
entries.emerald: It swims in the sea by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. The Cloyster shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
entries.firered: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
entries.leafgreen: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
entries.diamond: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
entries.pearl: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
entries.platinum: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.

entries.y: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
entries.omegaRuby: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
entries.alphaSapphire: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
entries.sun: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.
entries.moon: Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting tribes has turned up many spears tipped with spikes that had fallen off this Pokémon's shell.
entries.ultraSun: If areas of Cloyster's very hard shell get damaged, those areas swell, gradually growing into large sharp spikes.
entries.ultraMoon: Slowpoke tails are its favorite food. It has even been known to come up on land to look for Slowpoke from time to time.
entries.letsGoPikachu: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamonds shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
entries.letsGoEevee: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamonds shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
entries.sword: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
entries.shield: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
entries.shiningPearl: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.

entries.red: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
entries.blue: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
entries.yellow: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape as it appears to be made of a gas.
entries.stadium: Made of a thin, gas-like substance that induces fainting if you get enshrouded in it. Will not appear if it is very windy.
entries.gold: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
entries.silver: Its thin body is made of gas. It can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
entries.crystal: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
entries.stadium2: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
entries.ruby: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
entries.sapphire: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
entries.emerald: When exposed to a strong wind, a Gastly's gaseous body quickly dwindles away. They cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
entries.firered: A being that exists as a thin gas. It can topple an Indian elephant by enveloping the prey in two seconds.
entries.leafgreen: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
entries.diamond: This Pokémon's body is 95% made up of gases, which are blown away by strong gusts of wind.
entries.pearl: A Pokémon born from poison gases. It defeats even the largest foes by enveloping them in gas.
entries.platinum: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
entries.heartgold: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
entries.soulsilver: Its thin body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
entries.black: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
entries.white: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
entries.black2: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
entries.white2: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
entries.x: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
entries.y: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
entries.omegaRuby: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
entries.alphaSapphire: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
entries.sun: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
entries.moon: Although Gastly is barely visible, when it's near, a faint sweet smell lingers.
entries.ultraSun: It's said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokémon.
entries.ultraMoon: Poisonous gas comprises 95% of its body. It's said that the remaining 5% is made up of the souls of those who died from the gas.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape, as it appears to be made of a gas.
entries.letsGoEevee: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape, as it appears to be made of a gas.
entries.sword: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
entries.shield: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
entries.brilliantDiamond: This Pokémon's body is 95 percent made up of gases. The Pokémon can be blown away by strong gusts of wind.
entries.shiningPearl: It's a Pokémon born from poison gases. It defeats even the largest foes by enveloping them in gas.
entries.legendsArceus: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous—inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.

entries.red: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
entries.blue: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
entries.yellow: By licking, it saps the victim's life. It causes shaking that won't stop until the victim's demise.
entries.stadium: If you trip and fall for no apparent reason or hear a sound when no one is around, it may be a Haunter.
entries.gold: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
entries.silver: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
entries.crystal: It hides in the dark, planning to take the life of the next living thing that wanders close by.
entries.stadium2: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
entries.ruby: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
entries.sapphire: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
entries.emerald: If a Haunter beckons you while it is floating in darkness, don't approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
entries.firered: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
entries.leafgreen: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
entries.diamond: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
entries.pearl: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal the victim's life force. It lurks in darkness for prey.
entries.platinum: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
entries.heartgold: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
entries.soulsilver: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
entries.black: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
entries.white: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
entries.black2: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
entries.white2: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
entries.x: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
entries.y: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal the victim's life force. It lurks in darkness for prey.
entries.omegaRuby: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
entries.alphaSapphire: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
entries.sun: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
entries.moon: It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may be on the verge of extinction in cities that stay brightly lit at night.
entries.ultraSun: On moonless nights, Haunter searches for someone to curse, so it's best not to go out walking around.
entries.ultraMoon: It's dangerous to go outside alone on nights when you're feeling sad. Haunter will catch you, and you won't be able to go back home.
entries.letsGoPikachu: By licking, it saps the victim's life. It causes shaking that won't stop until the victim's demise.
entries.letsGoEevee: By licking, it saps the victim's life. It causes shaking that won't stop until the victim's demise.
entries.sword: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
entries.shield: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
entries.shiningPearl: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal its victim's life-force. It lurks in darkness, waiting for prey.
entries.legendsArceus: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.

entries.red: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.
entries.blue: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.
entries.yellow: A Gengar is close by if you feel a sudden chill. It may be trying to lay a curse on you.
entries.stadium: Appears to attack people who get lost in the mountains. Said to be the culprit behind shadows that laugh in the moonlight.
entries.gold: It steals heat from its surroundings. If you feel a sudden chill, it is certain that a Gengar appeared.
entries.silver: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.
entries.crystal: Hiding in people's shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
entries.stadium2: It steals heat from its surroundings. If you feel a sudden chill, it is certain that a Gengar appeared.
entries.ruby: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
entries.sapphire: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
entries.emerald: Deep in the night, your shadow cast by a streetlight may suddenly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
entries.firered: It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.
entries.leafgreen: On the night of the full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar's doing.
entries.diamond: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10 degrees F.
entries.pearl: Lurking in the shadowy corners of rooms, it awaits chances to steal its prey's life force.
entries.platinum: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.
entries.heartgold: It steals heat from its surroundings. If you feel a sudden chill, it is certain that a Gengar appeared.
entries.soulsilver: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.
entries.black: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.
entries.white: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.
entries.black2: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.
entries.white2: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.
entries.x: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.y: Hiding in people's shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
entries.omegaRuby: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
entries.alphaSapphire: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
entries.sun: Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden chill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar. There is no escaping it. Give up.
entries.moon: It apparently wishes for a traveling companion. Since it was once human itself, it tries to create one by taking the lives of other humans.
entries.ultraSun: You can hear tales told all over the world about how Gengar will pay a visit to children who are naughty.
entries.ultraMoon: Even your home isn't safe. Gengar will lurk in whatever dark corner of a room it can find and wait for its chance to catch its prey.
entries.letsGoPikachu: A Gengar is close by if you feel a sudden chill. It may be trying to lay a curse on you.
entries.letsGoEevee: A Gengar is close by if you feel a sudden chill. It may be trying to lay a curse on you.
entries.sword: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar's doing.
entries.shield: It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It hides in shadows. It is said that in rooms where Gengar is hiding, the temperature drops by nearly 10 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.shiningPearl: Lurking in the shadowy corners of rooms, it awaits chances to steal its prey's life-force.
entries.legendsArceus: Possesses potential victims' shadows in an effort to steal away the victims' lives. If your shadow begins to laugh, you must take hold of a protective charm posthaste!

entries.sun: Gengar's relationships are warped. It has no interest in opponents unless it perceives them as prey.
entries.moon: The energy of Mega Evolution awakened it. It sinks into another dimension, where it keeps a patient watch for its chance to attack.
entries.ultraSun: It tries to take the lives of anyone and everyone. It will even try to curse the Trainer who is its master!
entries.ultraMoon: Mega Evolution has made it possible for Gengar to access other dimensions. Its entire body is brimming with strange power.
entries.letsGoPikachu: It can pass through other dimensions and can appear anywhere. It caused a stir one time when it stuck just one leg out of a wall.
entries.letsGoEevee: It can pass through other dimensions and can appear anywhere. It caused a stir one time when it stuck just one leg out of a wall.

entries.sword: Rumor has it that its gigantic mouth leads not into its body, filled with cursed energy, but instead directly to the afterlife.
entries.shield: It lays traps, hoping to steal the lives of those it catches. If you stand in front of its mouth, you'll hear your loved ones' voices calling out to you.

entries.red: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.
entries.blue: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.
entries.yellow: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
entries.stadium: Its large body is over 26 feet long. Despite its size, it can squirm its way through the ground at 50 mph.
entries.gold: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
entries.silver: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
entries.crystal: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
entries.stadium2: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
entries.ruby: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
entries.sapphire: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
entries.emerald: There is a magnet in its brain that prevents an Onix from losing direction while tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes steadily rounder and smoother.
entries.firered: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.
entries.leafgreen: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to black-colored diamonds.
entries.diamond: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.
entries.pearl: It squirms through the ground using its long and rugged body. It always eats while burrowing.
entries.platinum: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
entries.heartgold: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
entries.soulsilver: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
entries.black: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
entries.white: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
entries.black2: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.
entries.white2: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.
entries.x: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
entries.y: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.

entries.letsGoEevee: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.

entries.shield: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
entries.brilliantDiamond: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.
entries.shiningPearl: It squirms through the ground using its long and rugged body. It always eats while burrowing.
entries.legendsArceus: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.

entries.red: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.
entries.blue: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.
entries.yellow: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it has eaten in the past.
entries.stadium: It puts its enemy to sleep and eats the victim's dreams. Said to have descended from the legendary beast, Baku.
entries.gold: If you think that you had a good dream, but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
entries.silver: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.
entries.crystal: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
entries.stadium2: If you think that you had a good dream, but you can't remember it a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
entries.ruby: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
entries.sapphire: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that a Drowzee is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
entries.emerald: A descendant of the legendary animal baku, which is said to eat dreams. It is skilled at hypnotism.
entries.firered: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.
entries.leafgreen: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entries.diamond: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entries.pearl: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entries.platinum: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entries.heartgold: If you think that you had a good dream, but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.

entries.black: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entries.white: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entries.black2: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entries.white2: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entries.x: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.
entries.y: If you think that you had a good dream but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
entries.omegaRuby: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat you dream through your nostrils.
entries.alphaSapphire: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat you dream through your nostrils.
entries.sun: A Pokémon that nourishes itself by eating dreams, it is thought to share common ancestry with Munna and Musharna.
entries.moon: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it's ever eaten.
entries.ultraSun: It can be spotted near recreational facilities, intending to eat the pleasant dreams of children who enjoyed themselves there that day.
entries.ultraMoon: It puts its prey to sleep and devours their dreams. It seems that bad dreams taste sour, so Drowzee doesn't particularly like eating them.
entries.letsGoPikachu: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
entries.letsGoEevee: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
entries.brilliantDiamond: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entries.shiningPearl: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.

entries.red: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
entries.blue: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
entries.yellow: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
entries.stadium: If you lock eyes with it, it will try to hypnotize you. It is best to close your eyes quickly before you get hypnotized.
entries.gold: When it is very hungry, it puts humans it meets to sleep, then it feasts on their dreams.
entries.silver: Always holding a pendulum that it rocks at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
entries.crystal: The longer it swings its pendulum, the longer the effects of its hypnosis last.
entries.stadium2: When it is very hungry, it puts humans it meets to sleep, then it feasts on their dreams.
entries.ruby: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
entries.sapphire: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
entries.emerald: The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum in a Hypno's hand lull the foe into deep hypnosis. While searching for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
entries.firered: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.
entries.leafgreen: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
entries.diamond: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
entries.pearl: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
entries.platinum: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
entries.heartgold: When it is very hungry, it puts humans it meets to sleep, then it feasts on their dreams.

entries.black2: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
entries.white2: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
entries.x: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.
entries.y: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
entries.omegaRuby: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
entries.alphaSapphire: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
entries.sun: While it is an extremely dangerous Pokémon, people who are in need of a good, sound sleep call it their savior.
entries.moon: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.
entries.ultraSun: In Alola, Komala is Hypno's main target. It rarely harms people.
entries.ultraMoon: There are some Hypno that assist doctors with patients who can't sleep at night in hospitals.
entries.letsGoPikachu: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
entries.letsGoEevee: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
entries.brilliantDiamond: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
entries.shiningPearl: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.

entries.red: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.
entries.blue: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.
entries.yellow: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.
entries.stadium: Lives on beaches and seashores. If a pincer falls off, a new, stronger pincer grows back in its place.
entries.gold: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
entries.silver: The pincers break off easily. If it loses a pincer, it somehow becomes incapable of walking sideways.
entries.crystal: If it is unable to find food, it will absorb nutrients by swallowing a mouthful of sand.
entries.stadium2: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
entries.ruby: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
entries.sapphire: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
entries.emerald: Krabby live in holes dug into beaches. On sandy shores with little in the way of food, they can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
entries.firered: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

entries.red: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
entries.blue: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
entries.yellow: One claw grew massively and as hard as steel. It has 10,000-HP strength. However, it is too heavy.
entries.stadium: Said to be capable of prying open Shellder and Cloyster shells using its 10,000-horsepower pincer.
entries.gold: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincer's size makes it difficult to aim properly.
entries.silver: Its pincers grow peculiarly large. If it lifts the pincers too fast, it loses its balance and staggers.
entries.crystal: Its over sized claw is very powerful, but when it's not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
entries.stadium2: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincers size makes it difficult to aim properly.
entries.ruby: Kingler has an enormous, over sized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the Pokémon quickly tires.

entries.sword: The flow of Gigantamax energy has spurred this Pokémon's left pincer to grow to an enormous size. That claw can pulverize anything.
entries.shield: The bubbles it spews out are strongly alkaline. Any opponents hit by them will have their bodies quickly melted away.

entries.red: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, they have zapped many people.
entries.blue: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, they have zapped many people.
entries.yellow: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
entries.stadium: Usually found in power plants. In some instances, they have been seen drawing power from the trolleys of electric trains.
entries.gold: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
entries.silver: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.
entries.crystal: During the study of this Pokémon, it was discovered that its components are not found in nature.
entries.stadium2: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
entries.ruby: Voltorb was first sighted at a company that manufactures Poké Balls. The link between that sighting and the fact that this Pokémon looks very similar to a Poké Ball remains a mystery.
entries.sapphire: Voltorb is extremely sensitive - it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.
entries.emerald: It bears an uncanny and unexplained resemblance to a Poké Ball. Because it explodes at the slightest shock, even veteran trainers treat it with caution.
entries.firered: A life-form whose identity is unknown. It is said to screech or suddenly selfdestruct.
entries.leafgreen: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.
entries.diamond: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.
entries.pearl: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

entries.legendsArceus: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

entries.red: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.
entries.blue: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.
entries.yellow: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.
entries.stadium: Stores enormous amounts of electricity within its body and explodes with the slightest provocation. Extremely dangerous.
entries.gold: It is dangerous. If it has too much electricity and has nothing to do, it amuses itself by exploding.
entries.silver: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.
entries.crystal: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.
entries.stadium2: It is dangerous. If it has too much electricity and has nothing to do, it amuses itself by exploding.
entries.ruby: Electrode eats electricity in the atmosphere. On days when lightning strikes, you can see this Pokémon exploding all over the place from eating too much electricity.
entries.sapphire: One of Electrode's characteristics is its attraction to electricity. It is a problematical Pokémon that congregates mostly at electrical power plants to feed on electricity that has just been generated.
entries.emerald: They appear in great numbers at electric power plants. Because they feed on electricity, they cause massive and chaotic blackouts in nearby cities.
entries.firered: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."
entries.leafgreen: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.
entries.diamond: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

entries.legendsArceus: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.
